title: ishida_aimi
body:

Sources heavily disagree on the reading of her given name 愛美. Anime News Network uses [i]Aimi[/i], but the name might as well be read as [i]Manami[/i].

title: hanying_(pgr)
body:
Hanying (pinyin: Hán Yīng) is a playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a side character introduced in [[Pulao (pgr)|]]'s interlude story and a playable Omniframe construct introduced during the patch 'The Floating Reverie'. A mechanoid produced by [[Villier (pgr)|]] in Kowloong, deactivated, and reactivated on a later occasion by the Church of Machina. Voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

h4. Appearance

title: nazrin
body:
The "Little Dowser General". Stage 1 mid-boss and boss, as well as Stage 5 mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A [[mouse girl|mouse]] youkai who can seek lost objects with her [[dowsing rod]]s, as well as the leader of a pack of [[mouse (animal)|mice]]. She is a direct subordinate of [[Toramaru Shou]], although not (until later) a follower of Shou's master [[Hijiri Byakuren]]. Doujinshi sometimes comically portray her being chased by [[Kaenbyou Rin]], [[Chen]], and/or [[Goutokuji Mike]] on account of their species. 

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23343446

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail]] with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[grey vest]] [[skirt set|and]] [[grey skirt]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], sometimes a [[grey capelet]], a [[necklace]] with a [[crystal]] [[pendant]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. Her mouse is usually in a [[holding basket|basket]] [[holding with tail|on her tail]].

h4. See also
* Pool #11329 - Shou's Missing Pagoda - Wanted by Nazrin or Shou, usually found in unusual places.
* [[Nazrin Day]] (20th July)

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Nazrin":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Nazrin

title: ferdinand_von_aegir
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Black Eagles.

Ferdinand is a confident and competitive noble, he strives to become better than [[Edelgard von Hresvelg|Edelgard]] in order to prove himself. Unlike other nobles, he does not look down upon commoners as many other nobles do. He is willing to understand what he did wrong and desires to improve himself when someone takes issue of him.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3809894

* !post #7474655: [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes]]

title: petra_macneary
body:
A character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] who hails from an archipelago named Brigid. She is the granddaughter of Brigid's king, and is thus a princess, yet she is studious and has a great work ethic. However, she has trouble speaking the language of Fódlan, which is shown in the Japanese version by her speaking in a slow and stilted manner (as if she has trouble finding the words), and in the English version by her using unusual grammar and not using contractions ("I am pleased to be meeting with...no, I am pleased to have met you.").

Has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]] that grow into [[large breasts]] as she gets older. She also sports a [[facial mark]] under her right eye.

h4. Appearance 

* !post #3588629
* !post #5365984: Post timeskip
* !post #5476714: [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes]]
* !post #7807348: [[petra macneary (summer)|Summer]]

title: hakurei_reimu
body:
The "Wonderful Shrine Maiden of Paradise" and main character of the [[Touhou]] series.

An easygoing but dutiful [[nontraditional miko|miko]] and good friend to fellow protagonist [[Kirisame Marisa]]; her cool, detached facade belies a sympathetic personality which often wins her the friendship of her former enemies, such as [[Remilia Scarlet]]. Reimu takes care of the rundown [[Hakurei Shrine]], which lay near [[Gensokyo]]'s border with the outside world and acts as its main portal, and fights using her [[holding gohei|gohei]], [[ofuda]], and her family heirloom, [[yin yang orb]]s.

Famous for her laid-back disposition and exposed [[armpits]], as well as the first subject (together with Marisa) of a notorious [[2channel]] meme - "[[Yukkuri shiteitte ne|]]!!!".

Her hair color is usually [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair|black]] of nearly every length and her eye colors varies between [[red eyes|red]], [[black eyes|black]], or [[brown eyes|brown]]. Her signature accessories are her [[frilled bow|frilled]] [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], her [[frilled hair tubes]] on her [[sidelocks]], and her [[yellow ascot]]. Her outfit is a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[red shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] with a [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon trim]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[red skirt]], [[white socks]], and either [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]] or [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

title: china
body:
On Danbooru, "China" refers to the [b]People's Republic of China[/b], otherwise known as mainland China, as well as the broader cultural and political idea of China.

States outside of Mainland China or nominally separate nations, tags such as [[Taiwan]] for the Republic of China, and [[Hong Kong]] or [[Macau]] may be used.

For the material that is sometimes known as china, see [[porcelain]].

title: mash_kyrielight
body:
[b]Mash Kyrielight[/b] (マシュ・キリエライト; also romanized as Matthew or Mashu) is a female character from [[Fate/Grand Order]] of the Shielder class. She is a Demi-Servant, a human fused with a Heroic Spirit. She works at the Chaldea Security Organization.

She is the first person the protagonist sees when he/she wakes up in Chaldea. She has [[short hair|short]], [[purple hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers her right eye]] and [[purple eyes]]. When not in her servant form, she wears a [[necktie]], [[black dress]], [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and [[glasses]]. In her servant form, she wears an [[armored dress]] and carries an enormous [[shield]], Lord Chaldeas (named by [[Olga Marie Animusphere]]). Later in the story it is revealed that [spoiler]the shield is in fact [[Lord Camelot (fate)|]], Galahad's Noble Phantasm.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Taneda Risa]] (before Sep 2016), [[Takahashi Rie]] (current)

title: rogamo
body:
A street food originating from the cuisine of Shaanxi Province in [[China]]. Literally meaning 'meat sandwich', it is minced meat, either beef or lamb, stuffed inside a piece of folded up flatbread, traditionally baked inside of a clay oven.

The term "rogamo" (otherwise spelled as rougamo or roujiamo) means "Chinese hamburger stuffed with meat". When you split the flatbread (shao bing) and add ingredients, it is called "rogamo". "Rogamo" refers to stuffed with meat, while "caigamo" refers to stuffed with vegetables. There are also variations like "liangpi gamo", "potato slice gamo", "huagan gamo", and so on.

In the game [[Genshin Impact]], the "[[Mora Meat (genshin_impact)|]]" food is a type of ”Rogamo”.

h4. See also
* [[Chinese food]]
* [[sandwich]]

title: lotus_flower_pastry
body:
A type of deep-fried [[dim sum]] from Hangzhou, China. Its layered crust and pink color makes it [[food art|resemble]] a [[lotus]]. The filling can vary, though the more common choices are coconut paste, lotus seed paste, and sweet potato paste. 

[[Genshin Impact]] adapts this dish into the [[Lotus Flower Crisp (Genshin impact)|]]. 

H4. See also

title: pigeon-toed
body:
Toes point inwards when [[standing]], [[sitting]], or [[walking]]. Pigeon toes are also called in-toeing,  often caused by genu valgum, or "knock-knee".

Knock-knee can be tagged as [[knees together feet apart]]. It's a medical condition that the knees are bent inwards causing the calves to be unaturally spaced out, while the thighs are closer.

So there may be overlap between the two tags, but not all knock-knees show pigeon toes, and not all pigeon toes show knock-knees. 

h4.  See also 

* [[knees together feet apart]]
* [[Tag group:Posture]]

title: waluigi_(super_rush)
body:
[[Waluigi]] wearing his attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Headwear[/b]: A purple fedora with white band around it, adorned with a red rose on the side.
* [b]Top[/b]: A snazzy, golf-inspired outfit. A striped, long-sleeve shirt (vertical gray-and-white stripes) is worn underneath. Over the shirt, he wears a purple vest with gold-colored buttons. The vest is slim-fitting, with a V-neck that reveals the shirt collar and stripes.
* [b]Glove[/b]: A single purple-and-white golf glove.
* [b]Botttoms[/b]: Matching purple trousers continue the color scheme, fitting rather snugly.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: His golf shoes are predominantly purple and white, tying in with the rest of his outfit. They have cleats and resemble [[saddle shoes]].

title: hoshino_akira
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Miyamoto Issa]]. She is one of the main female protagonists in their trilogy [[doujinshi]], Heart Mark Oome.

She is a friend of Yuu's who likes anime and manga, she also learns that his [[Saigawara Reika|sister]] is an ero-manga artist whom she's a fan of. She soon has [[sex]] with Yuu, and joins in [[threesome]]s with him and his sister.

[b]Akira[/b] has [[dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

title: waluigi_(tennis_aces)
body:
[[Waluigi]] wearing his attire from [i][[Mario Tennis Aces]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Headwear[/b]: A purple tennis visor.
* [b]Top[/b]: A short-sleeved purple polo shirt with buttons and a contrast collar.
* [b]Gloves[/b]: White gloves.
* [b]Bottoms[/b]: Navy blue shorts that come down to about mid-thigh.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: Ribbed purple socks.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange sneakers with white shoelaces and white soles.

title: saigawara_reika
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Miyamoto Issa]]. She is one of the main female protagonists in their trilogy [[doujinshi]], Heart Mark Oome.

She is an ero-manga artist and whenever she completes her work she as [[sex]] with her brother, Yuu.

[b]Reika[/b] has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She also wears [[glasses]].

title: rosalina_(ultra_smash)
body:
[[Rosalina]] wearing her attire from [i][[Mario Tennis: Ultra Smash]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless turquoise/sky-blue tennis dress with a slight flare at the hem. It has a simple round neckline. The skirt of the dress is short and ruffled. On her chest is a prominent star-shaped brooch or jewel, matching her usual star motif.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White tights (or leggings).
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Aqua shoes with a white toe cap.

title: choker
body:
A tight-fitting cloth band worn around the neck.

It's sometimes also worn in [[BDSM]] in place of a more traditional [[collar]].

Not to be confused with [[choking on object|choking]], which is a type of [[asphyxiation]], or with a [[collar]], which is usually made of thicker material and not as tight-fitting.

title: rosalina_(super_rush)
body:
Rosalina wearing her attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A short-sleeved collared aqua golf dress with a layered skirt. The outer skirt layer is aqua, and underneath it is a white layer. On her chest is a small star-shaped emblem.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White tights/leggings.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: White athletic golf shoes with aqua accents.
* [b]Glove[/b]: A single aqua golf glove.

title: princess_peach_(toadstool_tour)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless pink dress. The bottom hem of the dress features a decorative scalloped pattern.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up just above her ankles (nearly mid‐calf).
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Red shoes with a pink toe cap.

Notably, this outfit has extensive use outside of its debut game, appearing in [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i], [i]SSX on Tour[/i], [i][[Mario Golf: World Tour]][/i], and many other spin-off titles.

title: back_to_the_future
body: A franchise centering around the adventures of [[Marty McFly]] as he travels through time in the fictional California town of Hill Valley using a time machine in the form of a [[DeLorean]]. Popular since the first installment of its film trilogy was released in 1985 and became the year's highest-grossing movie, its cast includes Michael J. Fox as Marty and Christopher Lloyd as [[Emmett Brown|Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown]], the time machine's inventor.
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー
バックトゥザフューチャー

title: back_to_the_future_part_ii
body:
The 1989 sequel to the 1985 film [[Back to the Future]] and the second installment in the Back to the Future franchise.

It follows [[Marty McFly]] and his friend [[Emmett Brown|Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown]] as they travel from 1985 to 2015 to prevent Marty's son from sabotaging the McFly family's future. When their arch-nemesis [[Biff Tannen]] steals Doc's [[DeLorean]] [[time machine]] and uses it to alter history for his benefit, the duo must return to 1955 to restore the timeline.
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー2
バックトゥザフューチャー2

title: back_to_the_future_part_iii
body: Back to the Future Part III is a 1990 American science fiction Western film and the third installment of the [[Back to the Future]] trilogy. The film was directed by Robert Zemeckis, and stars Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen, Thomas F. Wilson, and Lea Thompson. The film continues immediately following [[Back to the Future Part II]] (1989).
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャーPART3
バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー3
バックトゥザフューチャー3

title: hi_hi_puffy_amiyumi
body:
2004 American animated television series based on the Japanese pop rock duo PUFFY (known as Puffy AmiYumi in the States for legal reasons). It follows the fictionalized and animated antics of [[Oonuki Ami]] and [[Yoshimura Yumi]], along with their manager Harada Kaz, and their pet cats Jang-Keng and Tekirai.

title: acrylic_stand_(object)
body:
A cutout image, typically of a character, affixed to a clear acrylic board and held up using a base. They're similar to a [[cardboard cutout]] but smaller, and commonly sold as goods similar to character [[figure]]s.

Use this tag when the acrylic stand is [b]an unimportant item in the illustration[/b]. If the medium of art is an acrylic stand, please use [[acrylic stand (medium)]].

title: rozen_maiden
body:
A manga by the group [[PEACH-PIT]], with an anime series of the same name. It deals obliquely with the pressures placed on children in Japan by telling the story of a student, Jun Sakurada, who cracked under the strain. The series chronicles Jun's reluctant mental recovery through experiences with the Rozen Maiden, a series of enchanted dolls tasked with fighting each other and taking their life force known as the Rosa Mystica, in a process called the Alice Game.

title: muimi_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. [spoiler]A former member of Eternal Society and the supposed "ninth" member of the Seven Crowns.[/spoiler]

She has [[blue eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She wears a [[torn cloak|torn]] [[brown cloak|brown]] [[hooded cloak]], [[torn shirt|torn]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[orange shorts|orange]] [[short shorts]], a [[brown belt]] [[belt pouch|pouch]], and [[bandaged leg|bandaged thigh]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate In-Game Costumes]]:

* [[muimi_(new_year)_(princess_connect!)|New Year Muimi]]: [[white kimono|white]] [[floral print|floral]] [[print kimono]], [[sash]], [[red hakama|red]] [[hakama skirt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts|bike]] [[short shorts]] [[bike shorts under skirt|underneath]], and [[black gloves]].
* Initial Muimi: [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]], [[orange shorts|orange]] [[short shorts]], a [[brown belt]] [[belt pouch|pouch]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[boots]], and a [[red cape]].
* [[muimi_(liberator)_(princess_connect!)|Liberator Muimi]]

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[muimi (real) (princess connect!)|Sonoue Muimi]] (園上 矛衣未).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Han Megumi]].

h4. See Also

* "Princess Connect Re:Dive Wiki: Muimi":https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Muimi_Sonoue

title: neneka_(princess_connect!)
body:

She is an [[elf]] who has [[pink eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[small breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[curly hair|curly]] [[pink hair]] stylized in [[twintails]] with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She wears a [[strapless shirt|strapless]] [[pink shirt]] [[white cape]], [[two-tone mittens|two-tone]] [[pink mittens|pink]] & [[white mittens]], [[red shorts|red]] [[short shorts|short]] [[puffy shorts]], [[red thighhighs]]. and [[pink headwear]].

She also has a pet [[chameleon]].

title: princess_peach_(tennis_64)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from the Nintendo 64 video game [[Mario Tennis (Nintendo 64)|Mario Tennis]]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A short pink dress with puffy short sleeves. There’s a lighter pink shade that makes up the main part of the skirt and a darker pink band or trim around her waist area.
* [b]Jewels[/b]: A large, round blue jewel in the center of her chest, matching her round blue earrings.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up to about mid-calf.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange tennis shoes with a thin band near the soles.

title: misora_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. She is a member of the guild Rage Legion.

She has [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[purple hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[black bow|black]] [[bow hairband]], [[hairclip]], [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white gloves]], [[blue ascot]], [[brown belt]], and a [[cape]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:

* [[misora_(summer)_(princess_connect!)|Summer Misora]]

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[misora_(real)_(princess_connect!)|Nagare Misora]] (流 魅空).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

title: wipers
body:
A windscreen wiper (Commonwealth English) or windshield wiper (American English) is a device used to remove rain, snow, ice, washer fluid, water, or other debris from a vehicle's front window. Almost all motor vehicles, including [[car]]s, [[truck]]s, [[bus]]es, [[train]]s, [[locomotive]]s, and [[watercraft]] with a cabin, and some [[aircraft]]s are equipped with one or more such wipers.

title: jr_211_series
body: The 211 series (211系) is a DC suburban [[Multiple Unit Train|Electric Multiple Unit]] [[Train]] that was introduced in 1985. It was originally designed and manufactured by [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways (JNR)]], and after [[Japan Railways|JNR]] was divided and privatized, Operated by [[East Japan Railway Company|East Japan Railway Company (JR East)]], [[Central Japan Railway Company|Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central)]], and Formerly Operated in [[West Japan Railway Company|West Japan Railway Company (JR West)]].

title: gundam_kimaris_vidar
body:
[b]ASW-G-66 Gundam Kimaris Vidar[/b]
A refit of the mighty [[Gundam Kimaris]], increasing its power even further via the addition of a special Alaya-Vijnana System that enabled its pilot, the mysterious Vidar, to operate the machine to the fullest of its potential.

[spoiler]Utilizing the remains of [[Ein Dalton]]'s brain for control, this meant Vidar, aka [[Gaelio Bauduin]], was able to abuse the Alaya-Vijnana without incurring any damage to his brain - in fact, the implant ended up helping him with his disability.[/spoiler]
other_names: ガンダム・キマリスヴィダール

title: v2_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]LM314V21 Victory 2 Gundam[/b]

An upgraded version of the [[V Gundam]] incorporating the V2 Core Fighter, loaded with a powerful Minovsky drive capable of pushing the [[mobile suit]] to suicidal accelerations of up to 20G. 

The exhaust plumes of the Minovsky drive often were released as the "Wings of Light", which served both as deadly offensive weapons and absolute shields, and the unit itself could be fitted with extra hyper beam cannons, variable speed beam rifles, I-Field generators, and a mega beam shield using the Buster and Assault optional armament sets.
 
It could also load all of them at once, creating a new, almost invincible configuration known as the [b]LM314V23/24 [[V2 Assault-Buster Gundam]][/b]. It was piloted almost exclusively by the League Militaire's ace, [[Uso Ewin]].

title: gundam_bael
body:
[b]ASW-G-01 Gundam Bael[/b]
The original Gundam Frame created during the Calamity War to fend off against the Mobile Armors. Bael was an all-round balanced MS that possessed no specific strengths nor weaknesses - however, after the war, its mighty symbolism among Gjallarhorn (it was assumed that Bael rejected commands and only the "righteous heir of Gjallarhorn" could successfully control the unit) meant that once it was obtained by [[McGillis Fareed]], who managed to pilot it, his political power grew exponentially.

title: h5_hayabusa
body:
The [[E5 Hayabusa|E5 series]] (Japanese: E5系, Hepburn: E5-kei) and the related [[H5 Hayabusa|H5 series]] (Japanese: H5系, Hepburn: H5-kei) are Japanese Shinkansen high-speed train types built by Hitachi Rail and Kawasaki Heavy Industries.

The [[H5 Hayabusa|H5 series]], a cold-weather derivative of the [[E5 Hayabusa|E5 series]], is operated by Hokkaido Railway Company (JR Hokkaido); it has been in use on Tohoku and Hokkaido Shinkansen services since 26 March 2016. Ordered in February 2014, a total of four 10-car sets were built by Hitachi and Kawasaki Heavy Industries. The first two sets were delivered in October 2014.

For the normal variant, Please use [[E5 Hayabusa]]

H4. Examples 
* !asset #23525004: [[Shinkansen]] [[H5 Hayabusa]]. Coupled with [[E6 Komachi]]
* !asset #23524365: Comparison of [[E5 Hayabusa]] (left) and [[H5 Hayabusa]] (right). The E5 has pink stripe while the H5 has purple.

title: ezo_red_fox_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Snowy Mountain Region in the anime.

As her name suggests, she is an [[Ezo Red Fox]] ([i]Vulpes vulpes schrencki[/i]), a red fox subspecies native to Hokkaido and Sakhalin.

Her outfit consists of what appears to be an orange blazer uniform with fur lined sleeves and a white pleated skirt, beige pantyhose fading to white at the feet, black gloves as well as a scarf tied into a bow. She has long blonde hair with black-tipped bangs along with the requisite fox ears and tail. She can be distinguished from a simple palette swap of Silver Fox with her lack of sidelocks. Her eyes are also a lighter amber color than her fellow fox.

More often than not, she is depicted as a slacker who likes to play video games.

She is often seen with [[Silver Fox (kemono friends)|]], a fellow fox Friend. Compare as well with [[Red Fox (kemono friends)|]], their nominate species Friend.
other_names: キタキツネ(けものフレンズ)

title: shoebill_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Prairie Region.

[[Shoebill]]s ([i]Balaeniceps rex[/i]) are stork-like birds known for - as their names suggest - their shoe-shaped beaks.

h5.Appearance
* [[long hair|Long]] [[multicolored hair]] consisting of [[grey hair|grey]], [[black hair|black]], and light [[orange hair|orange]]
* Hair is fashioned with a [[sidelocks|lock of hair]] on her left side that resembles a shoebill's beak.
* Her [[bangs]] form a neat point [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]], partially occluding them and exaggerating [[tsurime|her piercing gaze]].
* Has [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[bird wings]] [[head wings|on her head]] and a [[bird tail]]
* She appears to be wearing either a unitard or a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt]] with [[grey shorts]]
* Has a [[grey necktie|grey]] or [[white necktie]] and [[belt]] while her outfit has many [[pocket]]s
* [[black gloves|Black]] [[fingerless gloves]]
* Please note that she's wearing a silver [[bodystocking]] under her outfit and not just [[pantyhose]]
other_names: ハシビロコウ(けものフレンズ)

title: enoshima_electric_railway
body:
The Enoshima Electric Railway or Enoshima Dentetsu Line (江ノ島電鉄, Enoshima dentetsu), also known by the abbreviation Eno-den (江ノ電), is a Japanese railway which connects Kamakura Station in [[Kamakura (city)|]] with Fujisawa Station in Fujisawa, Kanagawa. Known for being the main railway access to the Sitting Buddha at Koutoku-in Temple (near Hase station), [[Enoshima]] island in Fujisawa, and the [[railroad crossing]] at Kamakura Koukou-mae station that directly faces the Pacific Ocean (as seen in [i][[Slam Dunk (series)|]][/i], [[Seishun Buta Yarou]] and [i][[Tari Tari]][/i]).

[[Mash Kyrielight]] in her kimono from the [b]Irohanihoheto[/b] [[Craft Essence (fate)|]], renamed [b]Although Its Scent Still Lingers On[/b] for the North American server. The kimono is white, the hakama is light blue, and the waist bow is pink and blue. She also has some flowers and a blue bow in her hair, and wears blue-framed glasses.

[b]Artist:[/b] [[Namie-kun]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3039532: (Example non-official art)

title: multiple_unit_train
body:
A self-propelled [[Train]] composed of one or more carriages joined, which when coupled to another multiple unit can be controlled by a single driver, with multiple-unit train control.
It is also possible for 2 [[Locomotive|Locomotives]] Attached in Front and rear of the [[Train]]. For Example the BR Class 43 HST.

H6. Note: Do NOT add the [[locomotive]] tag when no [[locomotive]] is present.

h4. Examples 
* !asset #23073982: Common layouts 
* !post #7718090: JNR 381 series Electric Multiple Unit
* !post #5811074: Enoden Type 1500
* !asset #23029965: American Stadler FLIRT Diesel Multiple Unit
* !asset #23074020: BR Class 43 HST Powercars Forming A MU Trainset 
* !asset #23689682: [[Japan Railways|JR Freight]] Mc250 "Sagawa Express"
* !asset #23121448: Two DF4 [[Diesel Locomotive|Diesel]] [[Locomotive|Locomotives]] Forming A MU Trainset

h4. See also

* [[Train]]

title: mash_kyrielight_(traveling_outfit)
body:
Heroic Spirit Traveling Outfit craft essence for [[mash_kyrielight|Mash Kyrielight ]]

Part of a series of 39 Fate/Grand Order Summer 2018 Craft Essences celebrating the game's third anniversary, each featuring a different Servant "on vacation" in a location unrelated to their historical legend and wearing clothing appropriate to the area.

title: dead_dead_demons_de_dedede_destruction
body:
Manga by [[asano_inio|Asano Inio]], running in Big Comic Spirits from 2014 to 2022. The story centres on an [[alien]] invasion of Japan contrasted with the ordinary lives of two teenagers, [[koyama_kadode|Koyama Kadode]] and [[nakagawa_ouran|Nakagawa Ouran]].

h4. Major characters
* [[koyama_kadode|Koyama Kadode]]
* [[nakagawa_ouran|Nakagawa Ouran]]
* [[ooba_keita|Ooba Keita]]
* [[kurihara_kiho|Kurihara Kiho]]
* [[hirama_rin|Hirama Rin]]
* [[demoto_ai|Demoto Ai]]
* [[takemoto_futaba|Takemoto Futaba]]
* [[tainuma_makoto|Tainuma Makoto]]

h5. Minor characters
* [[nakagawa_hiroshi|Nakagawa Hiroshi]]
* [[kohiruimaki_kenichi|Kohiruimaki Kenichi]]
* [[isobeyan|Isobeyan]]
other_names: デッドデッドデーモンズデデデデデストラクション

title: coralie_6626_planck
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]] Part 2[/i] playable character from Earth. Her full name is Coralie 6626 Planck and is voiced by [[Aizawa Saya]] in Japanese. 

She was born with Honkai-induced mutations resulting in [[animal ears]] and a [[tail]], while she is also portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[grey hair|grey]] [[two-tone hair|coloring]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7080586: [[Coralie 6626 planck (valkyrie blastmetal)|Valkyrie Blastmetal]] (default)

h4. External links

It is composed of a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]] worn underneath a [[white sweater]] and [[grey jacket|grey]] [[cropped jacket]], [[blue skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

title: erdos_helia
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]] Part 2[/i] playable character from Earth. Her full name is Erdős Helia (Erdős being the family name). Voiced by [[Kondou Yui]] in Japanese. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[hair intakes]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default (and only) outfit, [i]Valkyrie Boltstorm[/i], consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with [[frills]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black undershirt]] underneath, [[red jacket|red]] [[cropped jacket]], [[white belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[sneakers]]. 

She uses [[dual wielding|two]] [[crossbow]]s as her weapons. She bears a resemblance to both [[Thelema Nutriscu]] (from HI3) and [[Clara (honkai: star rail)|]] (from [[honkai: star rail|Star Rail]]).

title: cola_miku
body:
A style of [[Hatsune Miku]] involving a collaboration between Cocacola & [[Piapro studio|Piapro]] to create an illustration for vending machines. 

Other art has been made both before and after the event, however, the majority of it is related to the Piapro competition.

title: usada_pekora_(10th_costume)
body:
The 10th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]].

It's a [[jiangshi costume]] consisting of a [[blue hat|blue]] [[qingdai guanmao]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[mandarin collar]], a [[short dress|short]] [[blue dress|blue]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[frilled dress]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[blue sleeves]] [[detached sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|reaching past her fingers]], a [[thighlet]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform shoes]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this outfit, she has her [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair]] tied into held [[double bun|double]] [[braided bun|braided]] [[side up bun]]s that turn into [[twintails]].

Unlike other costumes, [[Don-chan (usada pekora)|]] appears as a [[ghost]] in this costume.

title: inu-oh
body: A 2021 animated musical fantasy film directed by Yuasa Masaaki and produced by Science SARU. Based on the novel [i]Tales of the Heike: Inu-Oh[/i] by Furukawa Hideo, the film follows the blind biwa player [[Tomona (inu-oh)|]] (who also takes the names Tomoichi and Tomoaru) and the deformed dancer [[Inu-Oh (inu-oh)|]] as they perform unconventional, anachronistic concerts in 14th century Japan.

title: yummy_snatchy
body: Yummy Snatchy is a [[Duel Monster]] that combines crane game mechanics, aliens, and cats into one being. This strange cat alien's main vehicle is a crab UFO. Its paws are used to snatch the other Yummy archetype monsters.

title: leggings
body:
Leg coverings similar to [[pantyhose]], but that don't cover the feet.

If the soles are covered but the toes and heels aren't, use [[stirrup legwear]] instead. If the leggings end at the thighs, like [[thighhighs]], tag [[detached leggings]] instead.

They are usually associated with '80s fashion; though they have made a comeback in the 2000s and are now a highly popular fashion trend among girls and women these days.

title: maeda_chihiro_(animator)
body:
Animator.

Her given name 千景 has the uncommon (but not unheard of) reading [i]chihiro[/i], and most sources gives the more common (but probably wrong) reading [i]chikage[/i].
Post #6718095 and post #6718070 from [[Newtype]] are attributed to a certain "CHIHIRO MAEDA" from [[Kinema Citrus]].
Only one Maeda from [[Kinema Citrus]] could be found, namely 前田千景. Which means that 前田千景, most probably, is Maeda Chihiro's name in kanji.

title: murata_himeko
body:
Murata Himeko is one of the main characters in the [[honkai_(series)|Honkai series]].

Himeko belongs to Saint Freya Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit, while also the Valkyrja Squad Fifth Platoon Commander-in-chief. Her rank is Lieutenant Commander. She is a good [[captain (honkai impact)|captain]] who is fully respected from her subordinates, able to perfectly carry out the strategy, deal calmly under any adverse circumstances.

The following year after her father’s death, she responded to call of the “Valkyrie Project” of the Houkai Fighting Strategy Unit Training Program. With her natural abilities and excellent understanding, she passed through many battles and became the existence called “Ishtar of the battlefield”. In addition with her calm deposit nature, precise judgment, superior leadership, she always emerges victorious in every one of her battles.

Due to not having the resistance against the Houkai energy at birth, Himeko was forced to have her body transplanted with artificial Stigmata developed by Shicksal, in their “Valkyrja” project,  a counter measure to fight against the Houkai. However, as the result of having her body remodeled, plus the side effects from the artificial Stigmata combined with the Houkai Energy taking a toll on her body, it has been declared that she only has one more year to live.

Current age as of Honkai Impact 3rd's start: 27.

title: fujinami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fujinami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]]-[[grey hair]] tied in a [[side ponytail]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and an [[ahoge]]; and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a purple [[sleeveless dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose|grey]] opaque [[pantyhose]] with [[lace-up boots]]. In her damaged art, she is shown to wear [[striped panties|striped]] [[side-tie panties]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[smokestack|funnel]] and [[mast]] worn like a backpack with yellow straps, two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a handheld 12.7cm twin gun mount.

In real life, she was completed in 1943, well over halfway into the war. [i]Fujinami[/i]'s only major engagement was the battle of Leyte Gulf, where she was part of Kurita's Center Force. During the Battle off Samar, [i]Fujinami[/i] rescued the survivors off of, then scuttled [i][[choukai (kancolle)|Choukai]][/i].  Two days later, she attempted to rescue the survivors of her sister-ship [i][[hayashimo (kancolle)|Hayashimo]][/i], but was struck by aerial attacks from the USS [i][[Essex (Azur Lane)|]][/i], and was lost with all hands, including those from the [i]Choukai[/i].

title: gambier_bay_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Casablanca[/i]-class escort carrier USS [i]Gambier Bay[/i] (CVE-73). Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She has [[blue eyes]], [[blonde hair]] and [[large breasts]]. Her hair is worn in large fluffy [[twintails]] that reach down to her shoulders. She wears a [[hairband]] in Measure 32 camo with radar antennae to one side. Her clothing consists of a [[blue_shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with [[breast pocket]]s, alongside a [[belt]] and [[shorts]] in Measure 32 camouflage. She also wears [[gloves]] with a white top and black underside, as well as [[white thighhighs]]. The one on her left leg bears her hull number, which is also found on her [[flight deck]].

She has a rather timid personality, generally sounding very meek and self-doubting due to her history, not helped by the common nickname for CVEs being "Combustible, Vulnerable, Expendable" due to their poor overall protection. Because of this, she often has a [[wavy mouth]] and looks as if she's on the verge of [[crying]]. She is also extremely fearful of her Japanese counterparts, especially capital ships, constantly worrying that they may fire upon her at any moment. She's often depicted as a [[lost child]] due to her [[Gambier Bay (Sasebo) (Kancolle)|Sasebo]] outfit; see "Lost Gambier Bay":[/pools/13799].

The historical [i]Gambier Bay[/i] was sunk in the Battle of Samar during the Battle of Leyte Gulf after taking gunfire from [[Chikuma (kancolle)|]], with [[Yamato (kancolle)|]] finishing her off. She was the only American aircraft carrier sunk by enemy surface gunfire during World War II, and also the only confirmed kill of the Yamato.

Her abyssal form is assumed to be the [[Escort Water Princess]].

title: akira_(kadokawa)
body:
Illustrator for Kadokawa Games. Mainly draws the boss and submarine [[abyssal ship]] enemy characters in [[Kantai Collection]]. They do some normal ship girls, though with a lazy streak (like [[Mizuho (kancolle)|]]'s seasonal CGs being the object being held by her changing). Nothing else seems to be known about him/her (or if Akira is more than one person, as there seems to be heavy shifts in style between art).

The credits for KanColle Kai lists her real name as Oikawa Mayu.

title: reverse_falls_(gravity_falls)
body:
A fanmade [[alternate universe]] version of [[Gravity Falls]] where all the characters have reversed or [[personality switch|switched personalities]]. Most versions also have the cast quite a bit [[aged up]] than how they are in canon, mostly as teenagers.

h4. Noteable Swaps

* [[Bill Cipher]] <--> [[Will Cipher]]
* [[Gideon Gleeful]] (Gideon Pines) <--> [[Dipper Pines]]/[[Mabel Pines]] ([[Dipper Gleeful]]/[[Mabel Gleeful]])
* [[Pacifica Northwest]] ([[Pacifica Southeast]]) <--> [[Mabel Pines]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Reverse Falls":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Fanfic/ReverseFallsAU

title: syringe
body:
A syringe is a simple piston pump consisting of a plunger that fits tightly in a tube. This tag is used to describe a hypodermic needle, which is a hollow needle commonly used to inject substances into the body or used to take liquid samples from the body. However, the needle portion itself need not be present for the tag to qualify.

Syringes are called needles in some areas of the world, but on Danbooru, [[needle|needles]] refer to the thin stick of pointed metal used for [[sewing]] or as weapons.

Use of syringes may cause [[track marks]].

h4. See also

* [[Holding syringe]]
* [[Large syringe]]
* [[Injection]]
* [[Doctor]]
* [[Nurse]]

title: injection
body: The act of using a [[syringe]] to transfer a liquid, often performed by [[doctor]]s or [[nurse]]s.

title: extra_digits
body:
Having more than five fingers or toes. Usually an [[artistic error]] which amateur and professional artists alike are prone to on occasion. Earlier versions generative AI are especially infamous for getting hands wrong this way. When not an error, extra fingers can often be found on mutant or otherwise monstrous humanoids.

Polydactyly is a real, albeit rare, genetic condition. Human characters with polydactyly include:

* [[Hannibal Lecter]] - [[The Silence of the Lambs]] (novel)
* Count Tyrone Rugen - [[The Princess Bride]]
* [[Iwamoto Kogan]] - [[Shigurui]]
* [[Ford Pines]] - [[Gravity Falls]]

h4. See also

* [[extra arms]]
* [[fewer digits]] - Less than 5 digits
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: wyvern
body:
A legendary winged reptilian creature regarded as a derivative of [[dragon]]. It stands on two legs and has two wings, and the tail may have a stinger. Another variant of wyvern is more serpent-like by having no hind legs, only wings.

title: tactical_playboy_bunny
body:
A [[playboy bunny]] suit that is accompanied by [[tactical clothes]], such as [[thigh holster]]s, [[ammunition pouch]]es, [[headset]]s, tactical jackets, and other tactical or [[military]] gear. The focus should be upon a (roughly) equal blend of both military hardware and the playboy bunny aesthetic.

Basically, the vibes are: if it looks like the person wearing the playboy bunny outfit is not only going to the photoshoot, but is also going to fight their way [i]out[/i] of the photoshoot with their guns and kit, then this tag is valid.

h4. Examples

* !post #5619628: Has magazine pouches, tactical belts, and holsters.
* !post #6085232: A playboy bunny outfit with additional tactical kit on top.
* !post #5881867

h6. Invalid Examples

* !post #5340134: Does not count because the gun is essentially a "prop" that the character has.
* !post #7471036
* !post #4674534

h4. See also

* [[tactical maid]]
* [[tactical school uniform]]

body:

title: military_operator
body:
A [b]special forces[/b] (derived from [i]special operations forces[/i]) is an elite [[military]] [[soldier|infantry]] unit being tasked for risky or demanding operations by the government or the army. An individual served in the special forces are known as a "military operator", or "operator" for short.

This tag covers images with military operator(s) armed with "tactical" [[gun|firearms]] (which may consist of prototype or advanced [[weapon]]s, especially those with the various mounted accessories such as [[laser sight|laser sighting system]], [[optical sight]]s and/or [[suppressor]]s). They are also usually seen equipped with [[tactical clothes|tactical]] loadout that may consist of [[ghillie suit]]s, [[bulletproof vest]]s, [[camouflage]]d [[military uniform]]s, [[helmet]]s, [[night vision device]]s, [[radio]]s and more. 

Certain SOF groups, such as the US Green Berets, British [[Special Air Service|SAS]], and Soviet/Russian [[Spetsnaz]] (also [[VDV]]), can be distinguished by coloured [[beret]]s. These are, respectively, green berets, red berets, beige berets and blue [[military hat|berets]].

h4. See also

* [[body armor]]
* [[load bearing vest]]
* [[sniper team]]
* [[tactical clothes]]
* [[trigger discipline]]

title: amane_kanata
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoForce|4th generation]]. Designed by [[Oshioshio]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]] and a few [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her default hairstyle is an [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[bob cut]] with a [[single hair intake]] and long [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]]. She also has [[mini wings|small]] [[gradient wings|gradient]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]] going from [[white wings|white]] to [[blue wings|blue]] and a [[star halo|star-shaped halo]] (which is sometimes compared to a shuriken) floating off-center over her head.

title: amane_kanata_(heavenly_guard_mission)
body:
The 8th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

It's a [[policewoman]]-themed outfit consisting of a [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap|peaked]] [[police hat]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[collared dress]] with a [[side slit]] and a [[white skirt|white]] [[quilted clothes|quilted]] [[miniskirt]] over it, a light [[blue necktie]], a [[chest harness]] with a [[walkie-talkie]] and [[belt pouch]]es hanging from it, a [[holstered]] magic [[gun]], [[white gloves|white]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] and [[white boots]] with [[colored shoe soles]]. She also an optional [[white jacket|white]] [[short-sleeved jacket]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[one side up]] with [[crossed bangs|crossed]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], her hair also now has a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]].

title: precure
body:
A [[magical girl]] anime franchise created by Izumi Todo and produced by [[Toei Animation]].

The [i]Pretty Cure[/i], or [i]PreCure[/i], are girls who are chosen to transform into magical girls to protect the earth. Though their origins differ throughout each series, they are always referred to as 'legendary warriors'. Whilst most later Cures are able to transform individually, some Cures, particularly in earlier series, often have to transform in pairs. Generally in each series, the girls chosen to become Pretty Cure are in middle school, though in recent series, there have been older and younger Pretty Cures as well as male Pretty Cures.

title: bismarck_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Bismarck[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[sleeveless shirt]] worn under a [[black shirt]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[brown gloves]], [[grey thighhighs]], [[grey collar]] with an [[anchor]], [[grey boots]], and a [[grey hat|grey]] [[peaked cap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel-and-mainmast piece to her back, linking a half-circle hull containing all four of her 38 cm twin gun mounts and two 15 cm twin gun mounts, with the turret colors changing per remodel form. She also gains 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] at [[Bismarck drei (kancolle)|Drei]]/Kai San form.

title: venom:_the_last_dance
body:
Venom: The Last Dance is a 2024 American superhero film written and directed by Kelly Marcel, which features the [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] character [[venom (marvel)|Venom]]. The final installment of the Venom trilogy following [[Venom (2018)]] and Venom: Let There Be Carnage (2021), it is the fifth film in [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU) and stars Tom Hardy as Eddie Brock and Venom, alongside Chiwetel Ejiofor, Juno Temple, Rhys Ifans, Stephen Graham, Peggy Lu, Clark Backo, Alanna Ubach, and Andy Serkis.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Venom: The Last Dance":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venom:_The_Last_Dance
other_names: ヴェノム:ザ・ラストダンス

title: morbius_(film)
body:
A 2022 [[Spider-Man (series)|]] spinoff [[Marvel]] film starring [[Jared Leto]] as the titular [[Morbius]], who becomes a [[vampire]] while attempting to cure himself of a rare blood disease.

The movie is notable for being the subject of several ironic [[meme]]s involving calling it "the most movie ever" or treating it as the "best" movie ever made, mainly due to its poor and cheesy plot, lackluster sales, as well as middling reviews despite massive marketing.

h4. See also

* [[It's morbin' time (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Morbius (film)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morbius_(film)

title: venom_(2018)
body:
Venom is a 2018 superhero film based on the [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] [[venom (marvel)|character of the same name]]. The first film in [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU), it was directed by Ruben Fleischer from a screenplay by Jeff Pinkner, Scott Rosenberg and Kelly Marcel, and stars Tom Hardy as Eddie Brock and Venom, alongside Michelle Williams, Riz Ahmed, Scott Haze, and Reid Scott. In the film, Eddie, a struggling journalist, gains superpowers after becoming the host of Venom, an alien symbiote whose species plans to invade Earth.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Venom (2018 film)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Venom_(2018_film)

title: spider-man:_into_the_spider-verse
body:
A 2018 animated film in [[Marvel]]'s [[spider-man (series)|Spider-Man]] series, loosely based on the Spider-Verse event from the comics. As in the source material, the film follows a story in which spider heroes from multiple different universes are brought together to stop an interdimensional threat. It notably uses a variety of art and animation styles to highlight the differences in the worlds each hero comes from. The movie is also notable for being [[Miles Morales]]' first film appearance.

The movie was a massive success, winning the Academy, Annie, and Golden Globe Awards for Best Animated Feature, and creating a wave of interest in a live-action adaptation of the Spider-Verse comic.

A sequel titled [I][[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]][/I] is set to release in June 2023, and a spin-off film focused around female spider heroes titled [i]Spider-Women[/i] is planned to release in the future. Several TV series spin-offs based on the characters are currently in production as well.

h1. Characters

title: gotland_(2020_race_queen)_(kancolle)
body:
[[Gotland_(kancolle)|Gotland]]'s race queen outfit introduced in 2020 during the Fuji Speedway Unagi Fes event.

The outfit consists of a [[blue bandeau|blue]] [[bandeau]]/[[crop top]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]] worn over [[white panties|white]] [[highleg panties]] with yellow and white accents, a [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]] with a [[checkered clothes|checkered pattern]] at the front, [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], and white [[thigh boots]] along with a [[headset]] consisting of a pair of [[headphones]] and an attached [[microphone]]. Also seen in the official art are a white [[winter jacket]] that she handles rather than wears and a green and white umbrella, both of which are optional.

Later became [[Gotland_(kancolle)_(cosplay)|a popular cosplay item]] wherein the main and accent colors of the outfit are oftentimes changed, from blue and yellow respectively, to suit the cosplaying character.

title: chicago
body:
Use for posts centered around Chicago such as culture or locations in the city. 

The city of Chicago is the largest city in [[Illinois]], the United States. The city is the third-largest after [[Los Angeles]] and [[New York City]]. Also nicknamed the "Windy City", the city was first incorporated in 1837 on the shore of Lake Michigan. The city is known for its architecture and is also noted for its contributions to urban planning such as the City Beautiful movement. It would grow during the course of the 19th-century. 

In addition to being a major cultural, financial, and industrial hub, the city of Chicago is renowned for its cuisine. Examples include [[Chicago deep dish pizza]], Italian beef, the Chicago-style hot dog, and shaved ice. 

h5. Locations
[[John Hancock Center]]
[[Willis Tower]]
[[Two Prudential Plaza]]
[[Franklin Center]]

h4.See also

title: houmonka
body: As its first step, Suì-Fēng stabs her enemy with Suzumebachi's blade. In addition to creating a rather deep wound, the attack leaves a butterfly-shaped stamp on the victim’s body. Spreading from the center of the wound, known as Hōmonka, this stamp becomes the target of Suì-Fēng's second attack. If struck in the same spot that was hit the first time, the person will inevitably die, and thus illustrate "Death in Two Steps.

title: quebec
body:
Use for posts referencing Quebec, such as the Quebecois Flag, Quebecois Sports teams such as the Montreal Canadiens, and/or depicting [[real world location]]s or culture such as food. 

Québec is a province of [[Canada]]. It is Canada's largest province by area, bordering Ontario in the west, Newfoundland and Labrador to the northeast, and New Brunswick to the southeast, and has coastal borders with Nunavut. 

The official language of the province is French. Quebec French (also known as Québécois) is the predominant variety, having some differences (primarily in pronunciations and vocabulary) when compared to European French. 

The province was settled by Paleo-Indians during the Last Glacial Maximum and was first explored by Europeans under Jacques Cartier in 1534, who would claim it for the Kingdom of France. France would continue to hold on to the colony until 1763, when ownership of the colony was transferred to the United Kingdom after the French and Indian War (AKA the Seven Years' War). It would later join the Dominion of Canada in 1867. In 1960, the Quiet Revolution would achieve major reforms throughout the province.

The capital of Québec is Québec City (French: Ville de Québec) and the largest cities are Montréal, Gatineau, Trois-Rivières, and Sherbrooke. 

Québec is the birthplace of [[poutine]] and is known for helping to popularize the sport of ice [[hockey]].

h4. See also

* [[Quebecois flag|Québécois flag]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Quebec":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quebec]

title: super_saiyan_4
body:
A form of [[Super Saiyan]] that originally appeared in the anime-only [[Dragon Ball GT]]. Born from gaining control over the [[Golden Oozaru]] form, its main features are red fur covering the torso, longer hair, red lining around the eyes, and the addition of a [[monkey tail]] even if the user already had them cut beforehand.

[[Son Goku]] is the first to achieve this form, followed by [[Vegeta]] and their fusion, [[Gogeta]] (whose Super Saiyan 4 form is different from his fusees, since his hair turns [[red hair|red]] and his body gains brown fur instead). It can be upgraded into [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4]].

[[Dragon Ball Heroes]] would later introduce a further evolution to this form, with the long name of [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4 Limit Breaker]].

The form would be canonized with its appearance in [[Dragon Ball DAIMA]], though appearance-wise it would see some changes, such as rendering the hair in the same color as the fur, and the arms and hands getting proportionally larger per GT's original concepts.

title: mauser_c96
body:
A semi-automatic [[handgun]] made by German arms manufacturer Mauser from 1896 to 1937. It used an integral box magazine in front of the trigger loaded by [[clip (weapon)|stripper clips]] and had a distinctive "broomhandle" style grip that could be used with a detachable [[shoulder stock]]. Originally chambered for the 7.63×25mm Mauser, while later and foreign variants were available in 9mm Parabellum, .45 ACP and more.

This tag also applies to its selective fire variant, the later [b]M-712 [i]Schnellfeuer[/i][/b] with higher-capacity [[magazine (weapon)|removable magazines]].

* !post #6008144

title: fujoshi
body:
Literally translated as [b][i]rotten girl[/i][/b], it refers to a female fan of [[yaoi]]. 

It should be noted that the concept of "yumejoshi" (a girl who enjoys imagining herself in a relationship with a fictional character, often through drawing and writing) has also come into use, though this is less common.

While the term [[otaku]] could be used for males and females, fujoshi specifically identifies females. Male fans of yaoi are called [[fudanshi]] instead. The equivalent words for overzealous fans of [[yuri]] are [[himejoshi]] and [[himedanshi]].

h4. See also

title: ro-500_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine Ro-500, the ex-[[U-511 (kancolle)|]]. Nicknamed "Ro". Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[tan]]. Her Japanese service outfit consists of a [[school swimsuit]], a cropped white [[serafuku]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[grey sandals]], a [[hair flower]] (a "satsuki azalea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satsuki_azalea], reference to her code name of "Satsuki 1-go"), and a [[bracelet]]. She is seen holding a [[lifebuoy]] and a [[torpedo]] strapped to her as her only [[rigging]]. 

Often portrayed in fanart with [[i-58 (kancolle)|I-58]] due to her 10:00 hourly line where she calls I-58 "Decchi", I-58's verbal tic, thinking it's her nickname instead of Gouya, making I-58 mad. Upon being acquired by Japan, U-511, now RO-500, did not score any kills or have a combat record; she was instead kept for analysis by the IJN for their late-war submarines.

title: ninomae_ina'nis
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member [[hololive English]]'s [[holoMyth|1st generation]]. Designed by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]].

She has [[pointy ears]], a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]] a pointy [[fang]] and a [[flat chest]] (much to her dismay), as well as two "ear"-like protrusions sticking out of her hair (a reference to similar flaps in some cephalopods), and pair of [[white wings|white]] [[low wings|low]] [[feathered wings]] wrapped around her waist. When in her "full" form she gets a [[halo]] above her head and several large [[tentacles]] on her back.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]], [[straight hair|straight]] [[purple hair|dark purple]]/[[black hair]] with two short [[sidelocks]] that turn into [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[orange hair|orange]] [[tentacle hair|tentacles]] and [[blunt bangs]] in a [[center-flap bangs|center flap]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[side ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a buttoned [[white dress]] with [[breast pocket]]s, [[red neckerchief]] and [[anchor]], [[red belt]], [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]], and her real-life funnel as a [[hair ornament]] with an emblazoned "E" [[Battle Effectiveness Award]] from her training exercises in 1938.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[Thompson submachine gun]] [[flight deck]] (though it should not be tagged as a Thompson), her aft flight deck with the "SARA" marking and two 203 mm twin gun mounts, and spare drum [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]] for a Thompson under her dress and additional box magazines on a garter holster, both emblazoned with the pre-1942 US military aircraft roundel.

title: witch_bandora
body:
Witch Bandora is a villain in [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]]. She was once the Queen of the Dall Tribe, who sold her soul to Dai-Satan for the power to avenge her son Kai, who was killed by a Tyrannosaurus for breaking its eggs. Unfortunately, in doing so she lost all memory of Kai, leading her to wage war on the other tribes and drive the dinosaurs to near-extinction before the Guardian Beasts sealed her and her followers away on the planet Nemesis. Years later, [[After 10000 Years I'm Free (meme)|a group of astronauts would unwittingly release them]], leading to Bandora resuming her mission to turn Earth into a barren wasteland, but was opposed by the Zyurangers, who had been put in magical stasis to awaken and protect the earth in the event of Bandora's escape.

Her counterpart in ([[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers|Mighty Morphin]]) [[Power Rangers]] is Rita Repulsa. Originally portrayed by Soga Machiko in both shows, albeit dubbed over by Barbara Goodson in Mighty Morphin, with Machiko even recording new scenes for the series' second season (the footage often being referred to as Zyu2), before being replaced by Carla Perez that season, giving [[Lord Zedd]] a love potion and 'aging herself down slightly' as to marry him in that continuity.

h4. See also

* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5078259

title: warspite_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Warspite[/i] (03). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] styled in a [[half up braid]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[corset]]ed [[white dress|white]] [[off-shoulder dress]] with a [[red ribbon]] in front. She also wears a [[black hairband]] with a [[mini crown]], [[white thighhighs]] held up by [[garter straps]], [[high heels|high heeled]] [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]], and a silver [[necklace]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is in the shape of a [[throne]] which she sits on, and contains her real-life crane and two 38 cm twin gun mounts, her real-life mainmast as a [[scepter]], and a [[globus cruciger]]. 

She is often considered the first foreign shipgirl to actually be able to speak her native language properly by fans, unlike those before her (the German and Italian shipgirls, [[iowa (kancolle)|Iowa]], [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]] and [[verniy (kancolle)|Verniy]] to an extent) that have been notorious for their [[ranguage]]. She even goes so far as to speak her English lines in a native-sounding, vaguely British accent (largely thanks to her voice actress being born in Australia). Although Warspite speaks with a Western-sounding accent, actual sentences, such as "Sally go!" demonstrate grammar a native speaker would not use.

Warspite behaves in the manner of a sedate, high-class British lady. She is often depicted in fanart alongside fellow English-speakers [[Iowa (kancolle)|]] and [[Kongou (Kancolle)|]]. She has hourly lines talking about Italian ships [[Littorio (kancolle)|]] and [[Roma (kancolle)|]], who she unsuccessfully tried to escort out of Italy following the Italian surrender, and [[Zara (kancolle)|]] and [[Pola (kancolle)|]], who she sank.

The historic HMS [i]Warspite[/i] was the Royal Navy's most decorated battleship, serving in both World War I and II. After a long career, she was scrapped after the end of World War II.

title: u-511_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German submarine U-511. Nicknamed "Yuu". Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She has [[long hair|long]] light [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey hat|grey]] [[garrison cap]] with her hull number print plus [[periscope]] and fins, [[grey jacket|grey]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black dress]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bow split into two halves, one on either side, and her real-life deck gun as a [[handgun]]. 

She speaks in a soft, quiet voice. She mentions in lines about how she is getting used to Japanese culture and the Japanese language, on account of historical transfer to Japan as [[RO-500 (kancolle)|]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: stonetoss_(style)
body:
[[Style parody]] of an American political cartoonist [[Stonetoss]]. Later become widely associated with [[Among Us]] [[meme]]s due to a [[third-party edit|photoshop]]ped image of his work into that of a [[Crewmate (among us)|]] (dubbed "Amogus"), usually to make fun of his political agenda.

Posts that features Stonetoss' "Amogus" crewmates can be identified by the more pronounced "feet" of the character compared to generic depiction of crewmates.

title: fbi_open_up_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] that references the [[fbi|Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)]]. The quote "FBI, open up!" is often used to humorously call out suspicious or inappropriate behavior, especially in online communities, especially pertaining [[pedophile]]s.

These memes are often accompanied by a clipped moment from a "skit":[https://youtu.be/c46_iL2QqOE]by Australian comedy [[YouTube|YouTuber]] "RackaRacka":[https://www.youtube.com/@Therackaracka], featuring a special police unit responding immediately to a smoke bomb setting off at a dull house party by violently breaking in to the home, causing chaos and destruction.

title: tokusatsu
body:
Tokusatsu (lit. "special effects") is a genre of Japanese [[superhero costume|superhero]]/[[kaiju]] live action film or TV shows. It was made popular by series like [[Ultra Series|Ultraman]], [[Super Sentai]] and [[Kamen Rider]].

Often features full-body costumed actors, intense choreography, numerous action scenes, as well as considerable use of special effects.

title: historical_event
body:
Pictures based on, or depicting, historical events. From ancient history to yesterday, any depiction of a noteworthy event should use this tag. Artist commentaries can sometimes prove useful for identifying such entries.

This tag is only for images that [b]directly[/b] depict actual historical events. For images that either indirectly depict an event or feature characters connected due to the shared history of their real life counterparts, use [[historical connection]] instead.

As such, do not use this tag for:
* Posts featuring characters with a [[historical connection]] performing fictional actions
* Posts featuring characters simply dressed in period-correct attire without depicting a real event 

h4. See also
* [[Historical connection]]
* [[Historical name connection]]
* [[tag group:history]]
* "pool:Wow That Was Fast":/pools/1823
* "pool:Current Events":/pools/5960

body:
A depiction of [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Sensei (blue archive)|]] (the player character), originating from [[Arona (blue archive)|]]'s drawing of the sensei. He is presented as a [[child's drawing]] caricature of a man with sparse hair and a rather distinctive "[[smile]]".

He is frequently used to represent the [[pervert|perverse]] side of the fanbase, and by far the most common depiction of sensei within the Blue Archive community.

Typically, Doodle sensei is depicted literally as a doodle from head to toe. Though he is also often depicted (particularly in NSFW works) as a [[faceless male]] with a piece of [[paper]] depicting the doodle attached on his face as a [[mask]]. In some cases, the entire head will be replaced with the doodle's version instead.

title: eroge_sekai_ni_tensei_shita_ore_ga_oshi_e_no_ai_de_netorare_heroine_o_shiawase_ni_suru.
body:
[b]Eroge Sekai ni Tensei Shita Ore ga, Oshi e no Ai de Netorare Heroine o Shiawase ni Suru.[/b] (エロゲ世界に転生した俺が、推しへの愛で寝取られヒロインを幸せにする。, lit. [i]I, Who Was Reincarnated into the World of Eroge, Will Make the NTR Heroine Happy with My Love.[/i], abbrev. [i]TenHero[/i]) is an ongoing Japanese web comic, written by Mizuki Mizushiro and illustrated by [[Satsuki Asha]]. It's being serialized in [i]Comipo[/i] since July 13, 2023, with three Volumes released as of February 2025.

The story follows Mitsuki, a college students who gets roped by a friend into playing an erotic game, [i]Hanaguri[/i], and promptly falls head over heels in love with the game's main heroine, [[Sakura Kotoha|Kotoha]]... But, the harsh truth is that he has been duped: Hanaguri is a NTR game disguised as a pure-love dating game, in which all the heroines are seduced by the player's best friend, Ryou.
While searching for a happy ending with Kotoha, Mitsuki accidentally falls onto the train platform. When he wakes up, he finds himself reincarnated as Kouki, the player character of Hanaguri!
With his vast knowledge of the game, and deep love for Kotoha, Mitsuki is determined to change fate this time.
In order to protect Kotoha and the others from Ryou, he must achieve a perfect happy ending.
other_names: エロゲ世界に転生した俺が推しへの愛で寝取られヒロインを幸せにする。

title: help:api
body:
Danbooru offers a REST-like API to make scripting easy. All you need is a way to GET, POST, PUT and DELETE to URLs. Responses are given in either XML or JSON format.

h1. Testing

API calls can be tested on https://testbooru.donmai.us. Scripts should be tested there before using them on the main site.

h1. Basics

HTTP defines four basic request methods: GET, POST, PUT and DELETE. You'll be using these methods to interact with the Danbooru API. Most API calls that change the state of the database (like creating, updating, or deleting something) require an HTTP POST, PUT or DELETE call. API calls that only retrieve data can typically be done with an HTTP GET call.

A URL is considered a resource and the HTTP methods are actions you perform on the resource. For example, GET "/posts/23.json":/posts/23.json returns a JSON representation of post #23. GET "/posts/23.xml":/posts/23.xml returns an XML representation. PUT or PATCH /posts/6.json would update the resource, for example changing its tags.

Some resources require parameters. For example, you can find tags that start with the letter 'a' by calling GET "/tags.json?search[name_matches]=a*":/tags.json?search[name_matches]=a*. This will give you a JSON listing of all tags with names starting with an a.

For POST, PUT and DELETE requests you must pass these parameters along in the body instead of the query parameters. Body parameters may be encoded in one of two ways. The usual way is with key-values pairs using "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded":

[code]
curl -u "$login:$api_key" -X PUT "https://testbooru.donmai.us/posts/6.json" -d 'post[rating]=s&post[tag_string]=danboo'
[/code]

Parameters may also be encoded as JSON using "Content-Type: application/json":

[code]
curl -u "$login:$api_key" -X PUT "https://testbooru.donmai.us/posts/6.json" -d '{ "post": { "rating": "s", "tag_string": "danboo" } }' -H "Content-Type: application/json" 
[/code]

h1. Responses

All API calls that change state will return a single element response (for XML calls). They are formatted like this:

[code]
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<response success="false" reason="duplicate"/>
[/code]

For JSON responses, they'll look like this:

[code]
{ "success": false, "reason": "duplicate" }
[/code]

While you can usually determine success or failure based on the response object, you can also figure out what happened based on the HTTP status code. In addition to the standard ones, Danbooru uses some custom status codes in the 4xx and 5xx range.

* [b]200 OK[/b]: Request was successful
* [b]204 No Content[/b]: Request was successful (returned by create actions)
* [b]400 Bad Request[/b]: The given parameters could not be parsed
* [b]401 Unauthorized[/b]: Authentication failed
* [b]403 Forbidden[/b]: Access denied (see [[help:users]] for permissions information)
* [b]404 Not Found[/b]: Not found
* [b]410 Gone[/b]: Pagination limit (see [[help:users]] for pagination limits)
* [b]420 Invalid Record[/b]: Record could not be saved
* [b]422 Locked[/b]: The resource is locked and cannot be modified
* [b]423 Already Exists[/b]: Resource already exists
* [b]424 Invalid Parameters[/b]: The given parameters were invalid
* [b]429 User Throttled[/b]: User is throttled, try again later (see [[help:users]] for API limits)
* [b]500 Internal Server Error[/b]: A database timeout, or some unknown error occurred on the server
* [b]502 Bad Gateway[/b]: Server cannot currently handle the request, try again later (returned during heavy load)
* [b]503 Service Unavailable[/b]: Server cannot currently handle the request, try again later (returned during downbooru)

h1. Authentication

You will need an API key if you need to login using the API. You can generate an API key by visiting your "user profile":/profile and clicking the Generate API key button.

To authenticate with the API, pass the [code]login[/code] and [code]api_key[/code] URL parameters, where [code]login[/code] is your username and [code]api_key[/code] is your API key:

[code]
https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json?login=your_username&api_key=your_api_key
[/code]

You can also authenticate using "HTTP Basic Authentication":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication]:

[code]
curl "https://$username:$api_key@danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json"
curl --user "$username:$api_key" https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json
[/code]

Most HTTP libraries support HTTP basic authentication out of the box. If yours doesn't, you can generate the authentication header manually. The format is [code]Authentication: Basic $secret[/code] where [code]$secret = base64($username + ":" + $api_key)[/code]. In other words, concatenate your username and API key together, separated by a colon, then "Base64":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64 encode the result:

[code]
curl --header "Authorization: Basic $(printf "%s" "$username:$api_key" | base64)" https://danbooru.donmai.us/profile.json
[/code]

If you are writing a user script for a browser, you do not need to embed an API key. You can rely on the user's session.

⚠️ [b]IMPORTANT![/b] Keep your API key secret. Treat it like a password. Gaining access to it allows full access to your account. Do not publicly post your API key or distribute it in scripts.

h1. Rate Limits
There's a global rate limit  on read requests of 10 requests per second regardless of account or endpoint.

Most kinds of update actions are rate limited according to user level:

* Basic users: 1 update/second
* Gold users and above: 4 updates/second

Each rate-limited endpoint has a burst pool, which lets a user make several consecutive updates before being rate limited. The rate at which the pool is recharged depends on the endpoint, but most follow the rates above.

The burst pool size, recharge rate, and current limits are returned as JSON in the [code]x-rate-limit[/code] HTTP header. They can also be found at "/rate_limits":[/rate_limits], which shows the limits as of the last API call (the page won't update until the API is used again).

Rate limits are shared between accounts and IP addresses: multiple accounts with the same IP address will share the same rate limit.

h1. Queries

h4. Common Search Parameters

All search endpoints support a common set of parameters:

* [b]page[/b] Returns the given page. Subject to maximum page limits (see [[help:users]]).
              You can also use [code]b<id>[/code] and [code]a<id>[/code] to request results before <id> or after <id>, respectively.
              E.g. to get a page of posts before post #999999, you'd make a request to [code]/posts.json?page=b999999[/code].
* [b]limit[/b] The number of results to return per page. The maximum limit is 200 for /posts.json and 1000 for everything else.
* [b]search[id][/b]
* [b]search[created_at][/b]
* [b]search[updated_at][/b]
* [b]search[order]=custom[/b] Returns results in the same order as given by [code]search[id]=3,2,1[/code].

h5. Parameter Parsing

Numeric search parameters support ranges:

* [code]100[/code]
* [code]>100[/code]
* [code]>=100[/code]
* [code]<100[/code]
* [code]<=100[/code]
* [code]100,200,300[/code]
* [code]100..200[/code] (inclusive)

Date parameters also support ranges:

* [code]2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]>2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]>=2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]<2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]<=2012-01-01[/code]
* [code]2012-01-01,2012-01-02[/code]
* [code]2012-01-01..2013-01-01[/code] (inclusive)

Boolean parameters accept any of the following values for true or false:

* True: true, t, yes, y, on, 1
* False: false, f, no, n, off, 0

Most string parameters support using asterisks ([code]*[/code]) as wildcards. Wildcards can be escaped with [code]\*[/code]. Literal backslashes can be escaped with [code]\\[/code].

h3. Show

The base URL is GET /related_tag.json.

* [b]query[/b] REQUIRED The tag to find the related tags for.
* [b]category[/b] If specified, show only tags of a specific category. Can be: general, artist, copyright, character, meta

title: jessica_the_liberated_(arknights)
body:
[i]Defender Operator Jessica, currently serving as sheriff of a li'l ol' Pioneer camp.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]]. 

An alternate form of [[Jessica_(arknights)|]]. Following her training under [[Blacksteel Worldwide (arknights)|]], 
after she decided to leave the company for her personal reason, she become a sheriff of the pioneer camp in Columbia. 
She currently provide Rhodes Island assistance in the local branch.

One of the main characters in the Side Story [i]Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures.[/i]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 3[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]149 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

title: list_of_project_diva_modules
body:
This is a list of all tagged module in the [[project diva (series)|Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA-]] series of rhythm games, listed in alphabetical order.

Modules are the [[official alternate costume|costumes]] available for the characters in the games. They can be associated with specific songs, be part of a series, or be a standalone design. As with other Vocaloid [[list_of_Vocaloid_derivatives|derivatives]], artists tend to portray each module as their own individual person (See post #1049414 for example).

h4. Hatsune Miku

title: ultraman_max
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Max (series)|]]. His human host is Touma Kaito.

He is voiced by [[Nakai Kazuya]].

h4. Items

* [[Max Spark]]
* [[Max Galaxy]]

マックス(ウルトラマン)
ウルトラマンマックス

title: ultraman_gaia
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Gaia (series)|]]. His human host is [[Takayama Gamu]]. Gaia is the manifestation of the will of the [[Earth (planet)|]] itself, bonding with Takayama Gamu to fight against the minions of the Radical Destruction Bringer and other monsters and invaders that threaten peace on Earth.

h4. Forms

* [[Ultraman Gaia (Supreme Version)|Supreme Version]]
* [spoiler][[Ultraman Gaia (Super Supreme Version)|Super Supreme Version]][/spoiler]
other_names: ウルトラマンガイア(キャラクター)

title: princess_daisy_(toadstool_tour)
body:
[[Princess Daisy]] wearing her attire from [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Top[/b]: A [[sleeveless]], bright [[yellow shirt]]. In the center of her chest is a decorative daisy emblem, similar to her [[earrings]], with a teal gemstone in the middle.
* [b]Bottoms[/b]: [[Short shorts|Short]] [[orange shorts|orange athletic shorts]] with [[yellow trim]] at the waist and leg openings.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: [[White socks|White]] [[ankle socks]].
* [b]Footwear[/b]: [[Orange shoes]] with a bright yellow toe cap.

Notably, this outfit has extensive use outside of its debut game, appearing in [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i], [i][[Mario Superstar Baseball]][/i], [i][[Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games (2007)|Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games]][/i], and many other spin-off titles.

title: ultraman_victory
body:
The secondary Ultra of [[Ultraman Ginga S]]. His human host is Shou. 
He is the guardian of an underground race of people called the Victorians and the guardian of the Victorium Stone. He transforms using the Victory Lancer and uses Spark Dolls to access the power of monsters via his signature ability of Ultlance.

h4. Forms

* [[Ultraman Ginga Victory]] (shared with [[Ultraman Ginga|Ginga]])
* [[Ultraman Victory Knight]]
other_names: ウルトラマンビクトリー

title: ultraman_victory_knight
body:
An [[alternate color|alternate form]] for [[Ultraman Victory]], introduced in the [[Ultraman Ginga S]] spin-off, [i]Ultra Fight Victory[/i].

In this form, his red and black markings replaced with blue and silver and his V Crystals turned red. And his main weapon is the Knight Timbre, a sword/flute object.
other_names: ウルトラマンビクトリーナイト
