title: labyrista_(princess_connect!)
body:
A [[Princess Connect!]] character, leader of the guild Labyrinth, and member of the Seven Crowns. She also appears in the remake, Princess Connect! Re:Dive.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]] with [[high ponytail]] & [[hair between eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[blue eyes]]. She wears [[glasses]], [[open coat|open]] [[red coat]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[halterneck]] [[black leotard]] which shows her [[cleavage]] and has a [[navel cutout]], [[red skirt]] and [[black thighhighs]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:
* [[labyrista_(overload)_(princess_connect!)|Overload Labyrista]]
* [[labyrista_(alpha)_(princess_connect!)|Alpha Labyrista]]

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[labyrista_(real)_(princess_connect!) |Mosakuji Akira]] (模索路 晶).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

h4. External Links

* "Princess Connect Re:Dive Wiki: Labyrista":https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Labyrista

title: bbb_(fate)
body:
BBB (ビィビィビィ, Byibyibyi?) is an "invincible anti-Servant robot of annihilation" created from old arenas of the Moon Cell Holy Grail War. She is an "unparalleled" mech-sized Labyrinth Robot guarding the third floor of the Sakura Labyrinth. In creating her, [[bb_(Fate)|BB]] spent two minutes going to the Near Side, collected parts and pieces of old arenas, disassembled them into an enemy program, reset it, and then programmed her own "superior thought routines" with lots of surplus memory. BBB was programmed not to leave the third floor, but Passionlip used Trash & Crush to crush her and throw her into the arena.

BBB is described by Passionlip as "self-important and uncute", and it is said she is more honest about her feelings than BB. 

BBB was planned to appear in the third chapter, but was scrapped due to not being an interesting boss.

* !post #8209906: Concept art

title: sheoldred
body:
Sheoldred, known as the Whispering One was the Praetor of the Black Faction of New Phyrexia. In the year 4562 AR, she led an invasion of the plane of Dominaria, where she attained several important military objectives in preparation for New Phyrexia's Invasion of the Multiverse. After her return to New Phyrexia, however, she lost a power struggle against the Mother of Machines, [[Elesh_Norn]]. Sheoldred was subsequently captured by Norn's forces and beheaded by [[Ajani_Goldmane]].

https://mtg.fandom.com/wiki/Sheoldred

title: mannlicher_m1895
body:
Ferdinand Mannlicher's final straight-pull [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was designed in 1895, to serve as the standard infantry weapon for [[Austria-Hungary]].

The rifle [[firing| fires]] the 8×56mmR in its 5-rounds, en-bloc [[clip (weapon) | clip]] and internal-magazine loading system, as its original predecessor weapon, the [[mannlicher m1886]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mannlicher M1895":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mannlicher_M1895

body:

She wields two black [[sig mpx|SIG Sauer MPX-K]] [[submachine gun]]s. Periodically subjected to [[fat joke]]s in fanart about her [[thick thighs|"100-kilo thighs"]].

body:
Brisela was created from the broken bodies and minds of [[bruna_light_of_alabaster|Bruna]] and [[gisela_blade_of_goldnight|Gisela]]. Once two of the most powerful angels on Innistrad, they were conscripted by [[emrakul_the_aeons_torn|Emrakul]] and are now melded together to serve as the Eldrazi titan's messenger.

title: gomen_yuuka
body:
A [[Blue Archive]] meme about [[Yuuka (Blue Archive)|]] being [[reverse netorare|cuckolded]] by someone else (usually [[Noa (Blue Archive)|]]) by stealing [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]], who she has a crush with.

The meme is often accompanied by Noa's catchphase "I'm sorry Yuuka" (ごめユウカ - gomen yuuka), though this is used in a more passive aggressive manner.

title: gomen_yui
body:
A catchphrase that later evolved into a [[meme]] that was originally said by [[Makoto_(princess_connect!)|]] during the [i]Maho Maho Kingdom[/i] in-game [[Princess Connect! Re:Dive]] event, expressing regret for falling in love with [[yuuki_(princess_connect!)|Yuuki]], despite her best friend Yui also being in love with the same person. 

Use this tag if any [[princess_connect!|Princess Connect!]] characters expresses guilt or regret towards [[yui_(princess_connect!)|Yui]] for [[netorare|taking]] [[reverse netorare|away]] Yuuki (the usual suspects are the aforementioned Makoto, [[kasumi_(princess_connect!)|Kasumi]], [[hiyori_(princess_connect!)|Hiyori]], and [[rei_(princess_connect!)|Rei]]), if Yui is visibly upset or jealous of Yuuki doing something with someone else, or if the phrase itself appeared in the image in any form (usually by swapping Yui with other characters).

h4. See also
* [[Gomen Yuuka]]

title: netorare
body:
A fetish in which someone close to the protagonist is either willingly or unwillingly seduced and stolen away. This isn't necessarily limited to one's lover, but may also include friends, unrequited love interests, or even relatives.

Closely related is netori/netoru (寝取り/寝取る). In this genre, the protagonist instead takes the lover of someone else. Also related is cuckolding, in which seeking out others is actively encouraged, even at the expense of the cuckold.

Posts on Danbooru should include the presence of the cheated on in some form, physical or otherwise (such as on the phone, as is common), or mentioned at some significant length. Do not apply this tag if only the artist's commentary mentioned that it was NTR-themed posts but other sign of it being such shown in the image itself (such as the "cuckolded" character being absent).

See [[reverse netorare]] for a situation where the victim of a netorare situation is a woman.

Not to be confused with [[cheating (relationship)]], which is when one party intentionally approached the third party without their partner's consent.

h4. Example
* !post #5474225:  Regular netorare
* !post #6636786: [[Reverse netorare]]

h4. See Also
* [[netorase]]

title: protagonist_(lost_property_control_organization)
body:
The technically unnamed (see Post #8567548 and Post #6901257), [[amnesia|amnesiac]] protagonist of [[Samidare (Hoshi)]]'s [[horror (theme)|]] [[video game|game]] concept series, [[Lost Property Control Organization (samidare)|]]. She has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]], [[aqua eyes]], and wears a pair of thin, [[white ribbon]]s [[hair ribbon|in her hair]] on both sides of her head. She wears a [[school uniform]] while working undercover.

Images that are chronologically early in the series depict her using a [[rust|rusty]] [[lead pipe|pipe]] for a weapon, while images from further down the timeline have her using a [[baseball bat]] wrapped in [[barbed wire]], a [[handgun]], [[spiked knuckles|spiked]] [[brass knuckles]], a [[stun gun]], a trick [[umbrella]], a [[golf club]], a [[sledgehammer]], [[bug spray]], or a [[harpoon]], depicting [[gameplay mechanics|upgrades]] or sidegrades that a player would make to their gear as they progress.

She is accompanied by a [[floating|hovering]] [[drone]], [[T-6407j (samidare)|]], and wears a [[hooded coat]] or [[hooded jacket|jacket]] while on missions.

title: slushie
body:
A drink composed of flavored ice and drink.  They're commonly produced using a machine that can chill and churn the beverage to keep it a mix of ice and liquid.

The [[spoon straw]] was originally developed to go with slushies.

h4.See also

* [[Shaved ice]]

title: mobile_suit_gundam
body:
A 1979 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] anime television series. It is the first show in the [[Gundam]] franchise.

Set in the far future, during the year [b]Universal Century 0079[/b] (79 years after the creation of the first permanent colony in [[space]]), it follows the story of [[Amuro Ray]], the teen pilot of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] mecha during the [[Earth Federation]]-[[Zeon]] conflict known as "The One Year War". The story of this U.C. series continues in [[Zeta Gundam]].

It was produced by [[Sunrise (company)|]], created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and "Yatate Hajime":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate (a collective pseudonym for the entire Sunrise animation staff), with mechanical designs by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. Tomino cited the 1959 novel [[Starship Troopers]] as an important inspiration for the show. He coined the term "[[mobile suit]]" for the show's mecha as a reference to the novel's "[[mobile infantry]]". 

The show is notable for helping to create the "Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot genre of piloted mecha and has spanned a very successful franchise lasting over 40 years.

This tag is for the 1979 TV series and related media only. For the franchise as a whole, use the [[Gundam]] tag.

h4. Characters

* [[Char Aznable]]

title: earth_federation
body:
The planetary governmental body from the Universal Century based [[Gundam]] series. 

They first appeared in the original [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979 and are enemies of the Principality of [[Zeon]]. 

This organization was heavily inspired by the "N.A.T.O.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO and the [[united_nations|U.N.]], from real life.

title: ground_gundam
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]RX-79[G] Gundam Ground Type[/b] are the [[mobile suit]]s used by the the protagonists of [[Gundam 08th MS Team]]. It later became a popular addition in other Gundam video games and manga such as [[Gundam Lost War Chronicles]].

The Ground Gundam is a less powerful but easier to repair and produce version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] prototype created by the [[Earth Federation]]. It has the same color scheme as the RX-78-2 but there are key differences between the two. It has a yellow V-shaped head fin, no beam sabers on its backpack, a single vulcan gun mounted on its torso, and a different short [[shield]].

title: gelgoog_s_char_custom
body: The [b]MS-14S Gelgoog Commander Type[/b] is an early production variant of the [[Gelgoog]] (also referred to as the YMS-14) with higher specs, intended to be used by ace pilots. The most famous example is the red unit piloted by the Red Comet, [[Char Aznable]], who battled [[Amuro Ray]] and the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] on a nearly equal footing.

title: rx-78-2_gundam_casval_custom
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]RX-78-2 Casval Custom[/b] is a version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] in [[Gundam Gihren no Yabou]] piloted by [[Char Aznable]], that sports his color scheme. Some video games (such as the [[SD Gundam]] series) also give it Char's trademark "Red Comet Kick" as part of its move set.

body: [[Luigi]] wearing his golf attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of green short-sleeved zip-up golf polo, a green visor-style cap, pleated white pants, a blue belt, a single white golf glove, and white golf shoes.

title: takamachi_nanoha
body:
The main character of [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]] and its sequels, [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's]] and [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS]]. 

Her [[magical girl]] outfit has the color scheme of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. This, and her propensity for huge pink lasers of doom, led fans to call her the [[White Devil]].

Her Intelligent Device is known as [[Raising Heart]].

She is voiced by [[Tamura Yukari]].

title: full_armor_gundam
body:
A manned [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. 

Making its entrance in [[Gundam Thunderbolt]], the [b]FA-78 Full Armor Gundam[/b] is a massive series of upgrades to the [[Earth Federation]] [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], with a new dark-blue paint job, four extra manipulator arms carrying shields, a twin-barreled beam rifle, and missile launchers at every corner, as well as the extra added armor, which can be ditched if need be, and extra boosters to aid in mobility. It was piloted by the brash and reckless [[Io Fleming]], who as usual, blared freestyle jazz through its communicator as he announced his presence to the battlefield.

Not to be mistaken for the FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam from the MSV series, which is a vastly different MS.
other_names: フルアーマーガンダム(サンダーボルト)

title: gundam_mk_ii
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

The [b]RX-178 Gundam Mk. II[/b] is a revised and much improved design of the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. While in testing under the [[Titans_(gundam)|]], the sinister looking dark colored prototypes were stolen by [[Quattro Bajeena]] and the [[AEUG]] with the help of [[Kamille Bidan]], who went on to pilot the sole surviving unit before switching to his own designed mobile suit, [[Zeta Gundam_(mobile_suit)|]]. The unit was later repainted white while at the service of the AEUG (to evoke the iconic look of the legendary original Gundam).

It was later piloted by [[Emma Sheen]] during the Gryps Conflict, and various different members of the [[Gundam Team]] during the events of [[Gundam ZZ]], more prominently [[Elle Vianno]].

h4. See also

* [[Super Gundam]]
* [[G-Defenser]]

title: gundam_ex
body:
A manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam Requiem for Vengeance]] [[Netflix]] series from 2024.

The [b]Gundam EX[/b] is a rare early [[ground_gundam|ground variant]] of the [[Earth Federation]] [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]. [b]EX[/b]tremely fast, powerful and resilient, it was designed for newtype use [b]EX[/b]clusively.

title: gm_sniper_ii
body:
The [b]RGM-79SP GM Sniper II[/b] is the ultimate [[GM_(mobile_suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] variant of the One Year War in [[Gundam 0080]]. It had augmented sensors, reinforced Luna Titanium armor in select places, greatly improved thrust and mobility precision, and an incredibly varied array of weapons including machine guns, beam rifles, beam guns, bazookas, and a powerful bullet firing sniper rifle which only the GM Sniper II was capable of accurately using. 

It was one of the few Federation units that could take the fight to Zeon's mighty [[Gelgoog]] and even challenge the monstrous [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] in terms of raw unit performance, if used properly.

h4. See also
* [[GM Sniper]]
* [[GM Sniper Custom]]
* [[GM Sniper III]]
* [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]]

title: nemo_(mobile_suit)
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime series and later in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

The [b]MSA-003 Nemo[/b] is a development of the [[GM_(mobile_suit)|]] line of mass production [[mobile suit]]s by [[Anaheim Electronics]] at the [[AEUG]]'s request. Since they had no experience with the GM, many parts were different, and the result was a vastly superior machine. Unlike the [[GM II]], the Nemo was constructed with Luna Titanium (or Gundarium) class alpha alloy, giving it the same armor resistance of the old [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]. 

Some elements of this MS (rear thrusters, main MS block) were also inspired by those of the [[GM Sniper II]], as several of the engineers who developed the GM SP II worked in the Nemo.

Karaba and AEUG units were painted green and blue. After The First Neo Zeon War in [[Gundam ZZ]], the remaining units were integrated into the [[Earth Federation]] forces with a white and blue color scheme.

h4. See also

* [[Nero_(mobile_suit)|]]

title: gm_(mobile_suit)
body:
A [[mobile suit]] that first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (1979). 

The [b]GM[/b] ([b]Gundam Mass Production[/b]), also referred simply as the [b]Jim[/b], is an [[Earth Federation]] mass production all-environment, generic, multi-role combat [[mobile suit]] based off the design and data obtained from the learning computer of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] more advanced prototype.

It is far less powerful and durable than the original Gundam due to heavily simplified and low-grade parts, but much cheaper to mass produce and easier to maintain, modify and repair. Due to its generally poor performance (being often depicted as a "cannon fodder" of some sort within the series), it spawned several variants, each with an attempt to make the mobile suit on-par with the more modern Gundams and whatever they were pitted against.

In real life, it was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] in the late 1970s, and was inspired by the [[M4 Sherman]] and [[T-34]] [[tank]]s of [[World War II]]. The mecha was also called the [b]Jimmy[/b] in the [[Genshiken]] anime comedy series.

h4. Variations of the GM

title: mobile_suit
body:
[b]Mobile Suit[/b], often abbreviated as [b]MS[/b], is the name of the [[mecha]] in the [[Gundam]] series. It basically refers to any (mostly) humanoid giant robot (standing from about 15 to 20+ meters tall) that is piloted by a human soldier (aside from [[G Gundam]], which uses the term [b]Mobile Fighter[/b]).

Most mobile suits are humanoid-shaped, though there are some which are not, such as the [[BuCUE]] and [[LaGOWE]] from [[Gundam SEED]].

This term was first introduced in the first episode of the original Gundam series, [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979. [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]], creator and writer of the series, explained that the concept of a manned robot was inspired by the [[super robot]] shows of the 1970s that began with the [[Mazinger Z]] anime from 1972. The name is also a tribute to the [[Mobile Infantry]], a fictional military organization of [[space marine]]s that uses [[power armor]] in the novel [[Starship Troopers]] from 1959.

h4. See also

* [[mobile armor]]
* [[man machine]]

body:

Unlike cold brew coffee which is brewed at cold temperatures over a long time, iced coffee is prepared hot and then chilled.

title: gundam_gp-01_zephyranthes
body: The [b]RX-78GP01 Gundam Zephyrantes[/b] is an experimental upgraded version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], built by Anaheim Electronics. It was briefly piloted by [[Kou Uraki]], and upgraded to the much more maneuverable [[Gundam GP-01 Full Vernian Zephyranthes]] after the original spec was damaged.

title: tem_ray
body:
A character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV series from 1979. Also plays an important part in [[Mobile Suit Gundam The Origin]].

[b]Tem Ray[/b] is a very intelligent [[Earth Federation]] [[scientist]] and [[engineer]] who helped to create the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. He is the father of [[Amuro Ray]] and the husband of [[Kamaria Ray]].

[spoilers]During the [[Zeon]] attack on the colony where the first Gundam was being tested he is sucked out into space after an explosion breaches the hull of the facility. Fortunately he survives as Tem was wearing a [[spacesuit]]. However, due to a prolonged exposure to hypoxia as he was rescued after his suit's oxygen reserves were almost depleted, Tem's brain is damaged permanently beyond recovery and develops symptoms of dementia. Later in the series his son [[Amuro Ray]] visits him and becomes shocked by Tem's mental condition. Sometime afterwards a [[crazy]] and disturbed Tem is last seen falling from the stairs of his apartment and his final fate is left uncertain.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Tem Ray's Circuit]]

title: unicorn_gundam
body:
A manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. 

The titular [[mecha]] (and plot device) from [[Gundam Unicorn]] (2010). The [b]RX-0 Unicorn Gundam[/b] is the "key" to Laplace's Box, a MacGuffin purported to contain a secret that could overthrow the Earth Federation government. Possession of the Unicorn Gundam is therefore hotly disputed, as it also acts as a map to the Box by way of a "La+ program" installed in its operating system.

Its physical design is a throwback to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], being a "white [[mobile suit]]" armed with a set of beam sabers mounted behind its head, a beam rifle with power equivalent to that of a battleship class beam weapon, and a shield with a viewport. It also incorporates concepts from its chronological predecessor, the [[Nu Gundam]], by adapting the Nu Gundam's cockpit-lined [[Psycho Frame]] throughout its entire body (visible in [[NT-D]] mode) and having the ability to use [[funnels (gundam)|]] or bits (though it requires the NT-D to be active and the enemy to have said remote weapons so the Unicorn could hijack them).

[spoiler] Upon its awakening, the Unicorn Gundam also gains abilities similar to the Nu Gundam's: The Shield Funnels (Unicorn Gundam's shields with a beam gatling gun attached on each), which has both offensive and defensive capabilities not unlike the [[Fin Funnels]] and the ability to create a phenomena similar to the Axis Shock. [/spoiler]

Piloted by [[Banagher Links]]. Designed by [[Katoki Hajime]].

The Unicorn Gundam's popularity led to a 1:1 statue of it, with partial Unicorn Mode to Destroy Mode transformation, to replace the original Gundam statue in Diver City, Odaiba, Tokyo.

h4. Other variants

* [[Unicorn Gundam Banshee]]
* [[Unicorn Gundam Phenex]]

title: bubble_tea
body:
Bubble tea (also known as "pearl milk tea", "tapioca tea", "boba tea", or simply "boba") is a type of [[tea]]-based [[drink]] invented in Taiwan. It consists of a mixture of tea, milk, or other flavorings, plus small black tapioca balls ("boba") that float at the bottom of the drink. The drink usually comes with an extra-large [[drinking_straw|straw]], used to suck up and chew the tapioca balls.

In 2019, bubble tea experienced a sudden boom in popularity in Japan, with a corresponding rise in fanart featuring the drink.

h4. See also

* [[Bubble tea challenge]]
* [[Disposable cup]]
* [[Iced tea]]

h4. External links

* "The Japan Times: Tokyo's tapioca boom":[https://www.japantimes.co.jp/life/2019/05/11/food/tokyos-tapioca-boom-find-bubble-tea-capital/]
* "Wikipedia: Bubble tea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubble_tea]

body:
A cool beverage made out of squeezed [[lemon|lemons]] and [[granulated sugar|sugar]].  Basic lemonade is typically a pale yellowish color, with commercial varieties having a more vibrant yellow color.  Other juices or dyes may be added to create other variety of lemonades, such as pink lemonade.

title: caterpillar_tracks
body:
A continuous track running between drive wheels, intended to give the vehicle greater off-road capability. Commonly used on on [[tank|tanks]], [[half-track|half-tracks]], as well as some [[bulldozer|bulldozer]]s, [[excavator]]s and farm [[tractor]]s.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Continuous track":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continuous_track

title: guntank
body:
The [b]RX-75 Guntank[/b] (or [b]RX-75-4[/b]) is a heavy fire support [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Unique for having [[caterpillar tracks]] as the main propulsion apparatus instead of legs.

It was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]].

h4.See also

* [[Guntank R-44]] - appeared in [[Gundam F91]]. Not directly related to this original Guntank except for its name.
* [[Mobile Suit GUNTANK]]

title: g-3_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It is a [[mobile suit]] from [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s novelization of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

The [b]RX-78-3 Gundam Unit 3 "G03"[/b] is visually identical to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] except for the G-3's grey and blue color scheme. The blue may be absent in some depictions.

title: 0_gundam
body:
[[Mecha]] from [[Gundam 00]]. Resembles the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from the first [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series.

The [b]GN-000 0 Gundam[/b] is the first Gundam developed by Celestial Being and the basis for the future [[GN Drive]] powered Gundams to be developed. It is piloted by [[Ribbons Almark]].

Designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]], who is also the designer of the RX-78-2.
other_names: フルアーマー0ガンダム

title: ribbons_almark
body:
Main antagonist of [[Gundam 00]]. He is the leader of the [[Innovators (Gundam 00)|]] and pilot of the [[0 Gundam]] and the [[Reborns Gundam]].

He is a walking reference to [[Amuro Ray]] from the Universal Century timeline. Aside from sharing the same [[voice actor]] ([[Furuya Tooru]]), their respective [[mobile suits]] also greatly resemble each other: 0 Gundam and [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]; Reborns Gundam and [[Hi-Nu Gundam]]. 

Due to those similarities, as well as Ribbons' role as a villain, fans nickname him as "Evil Amuro", with his 0 Gundam being called as "Evil RX-78-2" after the reveal that he is the pilot of said MS.
other_names: リボンズ・アルマーク

title: heavy_full_armor_gundam
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from [[Gundam MSV]].

The [b]FA-78-1 Full Armor Gundam[/b] is a variant of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] equipped with extra armor plates, missile launchers, a twin barreled beam rifle and even a huge shoulder mounted rocket launcher. It was developed into the [[Heavy Gundam]].

Not to be mistaken for the FA-78 [[Full Armor Gundam]] from [[Gundam Thunderbolt]] - a vastly different machine.
other_names: フルアーマーガンダム(MSV)
ガンダムフルアーマータイプ

title: zz_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

The [[AEUG]] [b]MSZ-010 ZZ Gundam[/b] (pronounced "Double Zeta" and codenamed "θ Gundam" or "Theta Gundam") is the titular [[mobile suit]] of [[gundam_zz|Mobile Suit ZZ Gundam]].

The unit is also transformable, turning into its [i]G-Fortress mode[/i], like its predecessor [[Zeta Gundam (mobile_suit)|]], equipped with the Core Block System like the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], and armed with heavy beam weaponry. However, its highly destructive arsenal needs a high output of power, draining its power especially when it fires its Hyper Mega Cannon.

This mobile suit is mainly piloted by [[Gundam Team]] leader [[Judau Ashta]].

title: nu_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. The lead Gundam featured in the film [[Char's Counterattack]].

The [b]RX-93 Nu Gundam[/b] was one of the most advanced [[mobile suit]]s of its time in U.C. 0093, together with [[Char Aznable]]'s [[sazabi|MSN-04 Sazabi]]. Both mobile suits are equipped with the revolutionary [[Psycho Frame]] technology.

The Nu Gundam's design is unique as it doesn't follow the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]'s signature color scheme unlike its predecessors, the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]] and [[ZZ Gundam|MSZ-010 ZZ Gundam]] and sports a white, black (or midnight blue) and yellow color scheme instead, has a mouthpiece with three vents as opposed to the standard two vents, is equipped with a pair of different [[energy sword|beam sabers]] with different mounting places (the larger beam saber is mounted on the backpack, near and behind the right shoulder and the smaller one is mounted on the left forearm) and also the first lead Gundam to be equipped with [[funnels (gundam)|remote weapons]] called the [[Fin Funnels]], which gives it its asymmetrical design when the funnels are docked. 

It is piloted and designed in-universe by [[Amuro Ray]]. In real life, it is designed by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]. In 2021, a life size replica of the Nu Gundam was announced for a Spring 2022 opening in Fukuoka. This version of the suit features an altered design and is referred to as the [[Nu Gundam (rx-93ff)|RX-93FF Nu Gundam]].

h4. See also

* [[Sazabi]]
* [[Hi-Nu Gundam]]
* [[Unicorn Gundam]]

title: gelgoog
body:
A [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeated in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979. 

The [b]MS-14A Gelgoog[/b] is [[Zeon]]'s final and best mass produced [[Mobile Suit]] during the One Year War. Extremely fast, powerful and armed with the cutting edge beam weapon technology, this advanced series of suits could even challenge the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].

It served in almost as many variations as its predecessor, the [[Zaku]], including a limited run of High Mobility Types and the higher spec [[Gelgoog S Char Custom]], famously used by [[Char Aznable]].

title: gundam_gt-four
body:
A transformable [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MS Generation]].

The [b]RX-78E Gundam GT-FOUR[/b] is an experimental prototype variable geometry [[mobile suit]] developed from the original [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] by the [[Earth Federation]] during the final days of The One Year War.

While the project was abandoned and the mecha was never mass produced, knowledge obtained from it greatly served for the successful development of future more advanced variable MS like the [[Asshimar]] and the [[Gaplant]] several years later.

title: gundam_g04
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

The [b]RX-78-4 Gundam Unit 4 "G04"[/b] is the fourth Gundam [[mobile suit]] unit produced during the One Year War. A space oriented version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], Unit 4 possessed a different backpack with more powerful [[thrusters]] and the mighty Mega Beam Launcher - a colossal, massively destructive weapon that required the suit's total output to be fired, which rendered it completely immobile during firing.

title: v_gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]].

The [b]LM312V04 Victory Gundam[/b] is a small but powerful combining [[mobile suit]] developed by the League Militaire to fend off the ever so present threat of the cruel [[Zanscare]] Empire. Its resemblance to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] gave the type its name. While many pilots took to its controls, the most known and lethal of them was, oddly, a 13 year old boy named [[Uso Ewin]].

Upgraded into the [[V2 Gundam]] configuration.
other_names: ヴィクトリーガンダム

title: freedom_gundam
body:
The [b]ZGMF-X10A Freedom Gundam[/b] is a nuclear powered [[mobile suit]] developed by ZAFT for long-ranged high speed combat, owing to its armaments and its 10-winged design. Its trademark feature is the "Full Burst Mode", the ability to take down multiple enemies in one full volley of its weapons.

It is designed as the companion unit of the [[Justice Gundam]], and is piloted by [[Kira Yamato]].

Owing to its popularity, the Freedom Gundam is one of four machines from the Gundam universe to have a 1:1 scale statue in the real world - in this case, in Shanghai, China - alongside the [[Unicorn Gundam]], the [[Nu Gundam]], and the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].

title: prototype_gundam
body:
A manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]RX-78-1 Prototype Gundam[/b] is an [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[mobile suit]] that is almost the same visually as the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]]. The 78-1 uses a grey, black, and red color scheme instead of the 78-2's parade colors. Not to be confused with the RX-78-2 Real Color type.

h4. See also

* [[Gundam MSV]]
other_names: プロトタイプガンダム

title: gundam_alex
body:
A [[mobile suit]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0080]] OVA in the 1980s.
 
The [b]RX-78NT-1 Gundam "Alex"[/b] is a vastly upgraded version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], as the original machine was already showing signs of obsolescence and simply couldn't keep up with the speed of [[Amuro Ray]]'s Newtype reflexes. It possessed a "Chobham":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chobham_armour [[Reactive Armor]] package, hidden 90mm wrist guns, a redesigned [[beam rifle]], and was much faster and possessed greater maneuverability thanks to extra [[thrusters]]. 

It was piloted in testing by [[Christina Mackenzie]], who successfully repealed a [[Zeon]] assault on the colony the test facility was located in, defeating the powerful but weakly armored [[kampfer_(mobile_suit)|Kämpfer]] before [spoiler]being totaled in a brutal brawl with [[Bernard Wiseman]]'s [[Zaku II FZ Kai]] which resulted in his death, neither having figured out that the pilot of the enemy machine was the other.[/spoiler]

title: gundam_rock
body:
[b]Gundam Rock[/b] is a cover album by hard rock musician [[Andrew WK]] released on September 9, 2009 only in Japan. The album consists of covered music from the original soundtrack of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] (the first Gundam series), but with English translated lyrics and vocals. It was released to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of the [[Gundam]] franchise that started in 1979.

The front cover artwork features an original illustration by respected Gundam and [[Capcom]] artist, [[Yasuda Akira]] (also known as "Akiman"). The image depicts Andrew W.K. floating in space next to the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] in similar fashion to [[Amuro Ray]] in one of the official posters of the [[Char's Counterattack]] movie.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Gundam Rock":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gundam_Rock

title: mazinger_z_(mecha)
body:
[b]Mazinger Z[/b] (also known as [b]Tranzor Z[/b]) is the titular [[super robot]] [[mecha]] from the [[Mazinger Z]] [[science fiction]] series by [[Nagai Gou]].

It is piloted by [[Kabuto Kouji]] and is armed with photonic laser rays in its eyes, "breast fire" thermal chest rays, a supersonic and corroding "hurricane" wind generator in its mouth, missiles, the "[[rocket punch]]" and super strength. 

Mazinger can fly, travel underwater and is constructed from a special, almost indestructible alloy called [i]Super Alloy Z[/i]. 

The titanic robot was created by Doctor [[Kabuto Juuzou]] ([[Kabuto Kouji]]'s grandfather) to combat [[Doctor Hell|Dr. Hell]] and his Mechanical Beasts, who desired the metal for their own nefarious purposes.

Mazinger Z is notable because it was the first piloted giant robot in the history of anime. According to Nagai, the idea of a manned robot came from one occasion when he was stuck in very heavy traffic inside a very small red car and he imagined it producing wings on its sides (like the [[pilder]] [[aircraft]]) and a giant robot body so it could walk above the other cars.  

The [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] was one of the many subsequent manned mecha inspired by this popular classic super robot.

h4. See also

* [[Pilder]]

title: g-fighter
body:
The [b]G-Fighter[/b] is a heavy [[starfighter]] that serves as a support unit for the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]].

h4. See also

* [[G-Armor]]

title: mobile_suit_guntank
body:
A fan made [[alternate universe]] [[parody]] of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] created by [[Nippori Honsha]].

In this version a hot headed, strong-willed and aggressive [[Hayato Kobayashi]] and his [[Guntank]] are the main protagonist of the story, while a meek, weak minded and bespectacled, deeply intellectual [[Amuro Ray]] and his [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] are side characters.

title: kyouryuu_sentai_zyuranger
body:
The 16th installment of the [[Super Sentai]] franchise. 

Introduces the concept of a sixth ranger to the team. As well as fantasy elements in Super Sentai, diverging away from the more science-fiction oriented elements of the previous series.

Also notable for being the first Super Sentai series to be adapted into [[Power Rangers]] for international audiences outside of Japan, in the form of [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]].

h4. Characters

* [[Yamato Zoku Prince Geki]] / [[Tyranno Ranger]]
* [i]Goushi[/i] / [[Mammoth Ranger]]
* [i]Dan[/i] / [[Tricera Ranger]]
* [i]Boi[/i] / [[Tiger Ranger]]
* [[Mei (zyuranger)|]] / [[Ptera Ranger]]
* [[Burai]] / [[Dragon Ranger]]

h4. See also

* [[Dino Buckler]]
* [[Ranger Stick]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyōryū_Sentai_Zyuranger
other_names: 恐竜戦隊ジュウレンジャー

title: g-armor
body: A heavy armored and armed variant of the [[Core Fighter]], the [b]G-Armor[/b] is the combined form of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] with parts of the the [[G-Fighter]].

title: ookawara_kunio
body:
[b]Ookawara Kunio[/b] (大河原 邦男, December 26, 1947—) is a veteran mechanical designer in the anime industry. A mechanical designer is similar to a character designer, but the design is for robots, ships, and other mechanical items found in a particular show. 

Ookawara was the first in the industry to be specifically credited as a mechanical designer. He designed [[mecha]] for the [[Gundam]] and Brave Series franchises, as well as those of numerous [[Super Robot]] and [[mecha|Real Robot]] shows.

He was born and currently lives in Inagi, Tokyo, where he works out of a studio in his home.

h4. Famous Designs

* [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] ([[Mobile Suit Gundam]])
* [[Guntank]] ([[Mobile Suit Gundam]])
* [[Zaku II S Char Custom]] ([[Mobile Suit Gundam]])

title: gundam_team
body:
A team of young [[Mobile Suit]] [[mecha]] and [[starfighter]] [[pilot]]s from the [[Gundam]] series. They first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

They are stationed onboard the [[AEUG]] [[space]] battleship [[Argama]] and later the [[Nahel Argama]].

h4. Members

* [[Judau Ashta]] / [[ZZ Gundam]]
* [[Elle Vianno]] / [[Gundam Mk II]]
* [[Roux Louka]] / [[Zeta Gundam (Mobile Suit)]]
* [[Beecha Oleg]] / [[Hyaku Shiki]]
* [[Mondo Agake]] / [[Core Fighter]]
* [[Ino Abbav]] / [[Core Fighter]]

title: v-fin
body:
A [b]V[/b] or [b]U[/b]-shaped head attachment commonly found on Gundams and similar [[mobile suit]]s, where they function as potent [[radio antenna]]s or other sensory and detection equipment. They may be a single piece, such as on the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], have protrusions like on the [[Strike Freedom Gundam|Strike Freedom]], be comprised of detached segments like [[Gundam Harute|Harute]]'s v-fin, or be made of energy or flames like on the [[Beginning Gundam]] and [[Phantom Gundam|Phantom]].

Please note that this tag does not necessarily implicate [[Gundam]] or a parody of the franchise, as mecha from other series may have the same design element.  Examples of this include [[Prowl (transformers)|]] and [[Strongarm_(transformers)|]] from [[Transformers]] and the [[Huckebein]] series from [[Super Robot Wars]].

Similarly, not every Gundam features a v-fin, such as the [[Turn A Gundam (mobile suit)|Turn A]], which has a [[mustache]], [[G-Self]], which has [[horns]], and [[Gundam Ez8|Ez-8]], which has an [[radio antenna|antenna]].

In [[real life]] the V-fins were inspired by the crests found on ancient [[Japan]]ese [[kabuto (helmet)|]] helmets.

title: rx-78-2_gundam
body:
The original Gundam [[Mobile Suit]] from the series [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Together with the [[Guntank]] and the [[Guncannon]], it is the final mobile suit of the [[Earth Federation]]'s Project V. It also serves as the [[Gundam]] franchise's mascot. It is piloted by the series' protagonist, [[Amuro Ray]]. 

Extremely powerful and resilient (thanks to its experimental [i]Luna Titanium Alloy[/i] or [i]Gundarium[/I]), it is equipped with an advanced A.I. system that improves the combat abilities of its [[pilot]]. The model was designed by [[Tem Ray]] specifically to counter the treat of [[Zeon]]'s standard mobile suits, most notably the [[Zaku II]].

Visually, the RX-78-2 has a white, red, blue, and yellow color scheme. It also has a white [[V-fin]] on its head unit, and is often seen carrying a couple of [[energy sword]]s, a [[shield]] and a powerful [[beam rifle]]. Not to be confused with the [[Gundam Mk II]], [[Strike Gundam]], [[Ground Gundam]], or [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]].

In real life it was designed by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and refined by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]] in the late 70s (Yasuhiko designed the Gundam's face mask and color scheme.)

The first Gundam was inspired by [[Mazinger Z (mecha)]] and the [[power armor]]s from [[Starship Troopers]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15913377

title: last_shooting
body: The iconic pose of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] before its mutual destruction with the [[Zeong]], firing a shot from its [[beam rifle]] straight up into the air, often while [[damaged]] and missing its head and an arm.
other_names: ラストシューティング

title: rx-78f00
body: The life-size moving [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mecha]] in Yokohama. Due to the logistics of building a life-sized mecha attraction, there are some slight changes in the design from the original, and [[gunpla]] based on the real life statue are released with this name.

title: edmond_dantes_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Notable for being the first Avenger introduced in the game.

Edmond Dantes is the protagonist of Alexandre Dumas' [i]"The Count of Monte Cristo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Count_of_Monte_Cristo][/i]. Good-natured and innocent in the beginning, he is framed as a supporter of the exiled Napoleon Bonaparte and imprisoned.  In prison he befriends another political prisoner, a priest named Faria, who educates him.  Dantes later escapes, and hardened by his experiences, he goes on to create a new identity for himself as the Count of Monte Cristo, and uses his new position to exact revenge on all those who wronged him in the past.

In [[Fate/Grand Order]] he does not consider himself as Dantes at all, rather as the vengeful King of the Cavern.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Komatsuzaki Rui]]
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]]

title: gundam
body:
A [[mecha]] media franchise created by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] and [[Sunrise (company)|]] in 1979.

Because of its popularity and longevity, the Gundam franchise is often considered the Japanese [[Star Wars]] (and [[Star Trek]]).

For the first Gundam show by Tomino, see [[Mobile Suit Gundam]].

title: doomguy
body:
The player character of the [[Doom (series)|]] series. Also known as the [b]Doom Marine[/b] and the [b]Doom Slayer[/b]. Usually depicted as a [[muscular male|muscular]] [[space marine]] with green [[armor]] and a [[helmet]].

Not much is known about Doomguy's life prior to the Doom games, but it is known that he was transferred to Mars in the first place because he had assaulted a superior officer for ordering soldiers to fire upon civilians. In the classic Doom games, the story is conveyed in the second person, and the player character is a silent protagonist.

h4. See also

* [[Doom (series)]]

h4. External links

* "Doom Wiki: Doom's protagonist":https://doomwiki.org/wiki/Doom%27s_protagonist

title: kamifish
body: Shares their tumblr and Facebook with [[EB (JJ and EB)|]].

title: guncannon
body:
A fire support [[mobile suit]] in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] universe first deployed in UC 0079. Main armament includes two 240mm [[shoulder cannon]]s, two 60mm vulcan cannons mounted on the head, and a [[beam rifle]] as a sidearm.

Unit Designation: [b]RX-77 Guncannon[/b] (the particular subtype  that appeared in the show is [b]RX-77-2[/b])

Its shoulder cannons are sometimes parodied by other characters with similar equipment, such as [[Blastoise]] from [[Pokemon]], [[Yasaka Kanako]] from [[Touhou]], and [[Shigure (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]].

It was designed by [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]].

h4. See also

* [[guntank]]

title: pauline_(tennis_aces)_(mario)
body: [[Pauline (Mario)|Pauline]] wearing her tennis attire from [i][[Mario Tennis Aces]][/i]. This outfit consists of a halter style sleeveless red tennis dress, a matching red visor, a white and yellow wristband, and black and white tennis shoes.

title: core_fighter
body:
A type of one-man [[starfighter]] from the [[Gundam]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979.

While there are dozens of different [b]Core Fighters[/b] - usually being a different model for each machine they are mated to - they all serve roughly the same purpose: forming the center of the [[Mobile Suit]], as part of the Core Block System, and acting as an escape pod in the worst case scenario.

h4. See also

* [[Core Booster]]
* [[G-Fighter]]
* [[G-Armor]]

title: amuro_ray
body:
Main protagonist of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] and [[Char's Counterattack]]/[[Char's Counterattack - Beltorchika's Children]], a supporting character in [[zeta gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] and eternal rival of [[Char Aznable]]. 

[b]Amuro Ray[/b], also known as [b]The White Devil[/b] by [[Zeon]] forces, is the young brown-haired pilot of the [[Earth Federation]] [[rx-78-2 gundam|RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]], the [[aeug|Karaba]] [[Dijeh]], [[AEUG]] [[Rick Dias]], [[Rick Dijeh Kai]], [[Zeta Gundam 3A Type]] and the [[earth_federation_space_forces|Londo Bell]] [[Re-GZ]], [[nu_gundam|RX-93 Nu Gundam]]/[[hi-nu gundam|RX-93-ν2 Hi-Nu Gundam]].

Son of [[Tem Ray]] and [[Kamaria Ray]].

In [[real life]] he is voiced by [[Furuya Tooru]].

h4. Amuro's Women
* [[Fraw Bow]]
* [[Matilda Ajan]]
* [[Lalah Sune]]
* [[Beltorchika Irma]]
* [[Chan Agi]]

title: adzam
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

[b]MAX-03 Adzam[/b]

The first [[mobile armor]] fielded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during "The One Year War". A massive combat [[walker (robot)]], it featured multiple twin-barreled mega-particle cannons on its vaguely onion shaped body as well as the unique "Leader" anti-mobile suit weapon. 

One unit fought the [[rx-78-2 gundam]] at the Odessa mining division base while a second unit would be encountered and destroyed by a [[Ground Gundam]] during the Battle of Odessa. A third and possibly final unit was encountered and destroyed by the White Dingo team in Australia.

title: sangokuden
body:
Japanese name:三国伝

Sangokuden is one of the [[SD Gundam]] series.
it is Gundam version of the Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

Historical character played by the Gundam's mobile suits.

h4. Characters

* [[Ryuubi Gundam]]([[Liu Bei]]:[[rx-78-2 gundam|RX-78-2 Gundam]])
* [[Kanu Gundam]]([[Guan Yu]]:[[ZZ Gundam]])
* [[Chouhi Gundam]]([[Zhang Fei (romance Of The Three Kingdoms)|]]:[[Z Gundam]])
* [[Koumei Re-GZ]]([[Zhuge Liang]]:[[Re-GZ]])
* [[Chouun Gundam]]([[Zhao Yun]]:[[V2 Gundam]])
* [[Bachou Blue destiny]]([[Ma Chao]]:[[Blue Destiny 01]])
* [[Kouchuu Gundam]]([[Huang Zhong]]:[[Gundam Mk2]])
* [[Kanpei Gundam]]([[Guan Ping]]:[[S Gundam]])

title: dijeh
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985.

[b]MSK-008 Dijeh[/b]

A competent and powerful ground combat [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[AEUG|Karaba]] resistance organization on Earth by using a heavily modified AEUG [[Rick Dias]], during The Gryps War against the brutal and oppresive [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. While its visor might resemble a monoeye, it has a [[rx-78-2 gundam|Gundam]]-esque faceplate underneath it. 

One unit was piloted by [[Amuro Ray]] during [[zeta_Gundam|the Gryps Conflict]], and many of them were deployed with degrees of success by PMCs in [[gundam_narrative|UC 0097]] - a full 10 years after its introduction, a testament to its effectiveness in MS combat.

h4. See also
* [[Rick Dijeh Kai]]
* [[Dijeh SE-R]]

body:

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair rings]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[red capelet]], [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[cross-laced_top|cross-laced]] [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts|bike]] [[short shorts]] [[shorts under skirt|under her skirt]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]].

body:

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], the uniform is a Mystic Code available for either protagonist. The male uniform was not introduced until [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|Male Ritsuka]]'s outfit in FGO.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24908519

title: chaldea_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by members of the [[Chaldea Security Organization]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. 

There are many variants of the uniform, depending on the rank and position the member is. [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|Male Ritsuka]] and [[fujimaru ritsuka (female)|Female Ritsuka]] wear a white shirt with black buckles on the chest, with the male uniform having [[black pants]] and the female uniform having a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]]. [[Romani Archaman]] wears a doctor's uniform beneath a white coat. Other staff members like [[Jingle Abel Meuniere]] and [[Sylvia (fate)|]] wear a black shirt with the secondary color being different depending on the gender - orange for women, and aqua for men - and either [[white pants]] or a [[white skirt]]. 

[[Dark Young (fate)|]] has the same coloration as the protagonists' Chaldea uniforms.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4375274

h4.See also

* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: tank
body:
An armored, [[caterpillar tracks|tracked]] [[military vehicle]] with a single [[cannon]] (some tanks may have mounted [[machine gun]]s or more than one cannon). Its heavy armor protects  the crew from enemy fire while the tracks let it traverse difficult terrain or obstacles.

For tagging purposes this tag may also be used on any tank-like [[motor vehicle|vehicle]], whether real or fictional. This may include things such as [[tank destroyer]]s (ex: [[Sturmgeschutz III]]), [[self-propelled artillery]] (ex: [[M109 Howitzer]]), rocket artillery, and the like.

For the container type tank, use the tag: [[tank (container)]]. Do not confuse with [[tank top]], which refers to a type of shirt.

h4. Examples

* !post #7558772: Modern Main Battle Tank (MBT) ([[M1 Abrams]])
* !post #8075834: [[Turretless Tank|Turretless]] [[Tank Destroyer]] ([[Sturmgeschutz III]])
* !post #2641172: Tracked [[Self-propelled Artillery]] ([[M109 Howitzer]])

h4. See also
* [[Armored vehicle]]
* [[Reactive armor]]
* [[Tank turret]]
* [[Turretless tank]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Tank":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tank

title: lewis_carroll
body: Charles Lutwidge Dodgson (/ˈlʌtwɪdʒ ˈdɒdsən/ LUT-wij DOD-sən; 27 January 1832 – 14 January 1898), better known by his pen name Lewis Carroll, was an English author, poet, mathematician, photographer and reluctant Anglican deacon. His most notable works are [[alice in wonderland|Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]] (1865) and its sequel Through the Looking-Glass (1871). He was noted for his facility with word play, logic, and fantasy. His poems Jabberwocky (1871) and The Hunting of the Snark (1876) are classified in the genre of literary nonsense. Some of Alice's nonsensical wonderland logic reflects his published work on mathematical logic.

title: alice_in_wonderland
body:
The collective name of a book duology by English author [[Lewis Carroll]] as well as a large media franchise which resulted from them.

The first book, [i]Alice's Adventures in Wonderland[/i] (1865), tells the story of a girl named Alice, who falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar and anthropomorphic creatures. [i]Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There[/i] (1871) is a continuation in which Alice goes through the titular looking glass and enters a world that works like a chess board. Once again, Alice finds various peculiar and anthropomorphic creatures and has to deal with their eccentricities.

title: cfa-44_nosferatu
body:
A fictional [[fighter jet]] that appeared in [[Ace Combat 6]]. Some counterparts of the airplane appeared in [[Ace Combat Assault Horizon]] (as a DLC) and  [[Ace Combat Infinity]] (as an unmanned aircraft called [[QFA-44 Carmilla]]).
In the AC6, it was developed by Estovakia and piloted by [[Ilya Pasternak]]. It has the function to control a large number of [[unmanned aerial vehicle|UAVs]] called [[uav-45_malebolge|Malebolge]].

title: x-men
body:
A comic book franchise owned and published by [[Marvel]].

[[Marvel|Set in a world]] where a race of humans, dubbed "mutants", that are born with superhuman abilities that manifest during puberty (sometimes at birth). Due to several mutants exploiting their powers for sinister purposes, the world of X-Men is predominantly ruled by anti-mutant leaders who seeks to exterminate all mutants, along with social discrimination against them not dissimilar to racism.

The franchise centered around the eponymous "X-Men" organization founded by  [[Charles Xavier|Prof. Charles Francis Xavier]], who seeks to unite all benevolent mutants to combat the villianous mutants in hope of creating the world where both humans and mutants can peacefully coexists.

title: alucard_(castlevania)
body:
Full name: Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (also Adrian Farenheights Tepes).

The son of [[dracula (castlevania)|Count Dracula]] and a human woman named [[Lisa (Castlevania)|]]. A recurring protagonist of the [[Castlevania (series)|]] series of video games, he first appeared as a guest character in [[Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse]] and became the main playable character in [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]], which marked the first time a non-Belmont and non-whip user took center stage.

His 21st century alias is [[Arikado Genya]].

title: gourmet_research_society_(blue_archive)
body:
The Gourmet Research Society is one of the clubs at Gehenna Academy in [[Blue Archive]].

A club centered around its leader, [[Haruna (blue archive)|]]. Their sole purpose is to sample every aspect of food. Despite the name of the club, it can be pretty troublesome even by Gehenna standards. With food being the club's priority, its members will throw themselves into trouble for the sake of it. Their motto is [b]"Eat or Die"[/b], which showcases their dedication although each member has their own taste when it comes to "good" food.

Because it is food-related, [[Fuuka (blue archive)|]] from the Gehenna Academy School Lunch Club is often the target of their attention.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Haruna (blue archive)|]]

* [[Izumi (blue archive)|]]

title: turretless_tank
body:
A [[tank]] or tank-like armored [[military vehicle]] featuring a casemate (turretless) design, with the main gun mounted directly within the hull of the vehicle instead of in a rotating turret.

Advantages of such designs were that they were mechanically simpler than turreted designs, less costly to produce, lighter in weight, and lower in profile. Due to taking up less weight in the design, heavier armor and/or armaments could be added onto the chassis.  A primary disadvantage to this design was that the main weapon was affixed with a limited fire arc in the front and thus required the entire vehicle rotating to be able to target things outside this arc.

h4. Examples

* !post #1475708: [[Jagdpanther]]

h4. List of Real Life Vehicles

h6. WWII - German

* [[Jagdpanther]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)|Jagdpanzer 38(t) - "Hetzer"]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Jagdtiger]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmgeschutz III]] (Assault Gun/Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmgeschutz IV]] (Assault Gun/Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmtiger]] (Assault Gun)

h6. WWII - Russian

* [[SU-85]] (Tank Destroyer)

title: self-propelled_artillery
body:
A motorized field artillery or anti-tank gun. The difference between it and a [[tank]] is that the latter is a versatile support vehicle designed to help infantry, while a self-propelled gun is a mobile gun with a single purpose. A [[tank destroyer]] is technically a self-propelled gun but because of the similarity to a normal [[tank]], they tend to be grouped under tanks.

Anti-tank self-propelled guns generally have the gun mounted to the chassis itself in a [[turretless tank|turretless]] design (like the German Stug/Stuh or Russian SU-series of guns). Artillery pieces are more varied in design and can have a turret or an exposed cannon. 

This only applies to artillery pieces with a cannon; mobile rocket launchers are not covered by this term.

h4. See also

* [[Jagdpanther]]

* [[Panzerhaubitze 2000]]

title: sturmgeschutz_iii
body:
The [b]Sturmgeschütz III[/b] ([b]StuG III[/b]) assault gun was Germany's most produced armored fighting vehicle during [[World War II]]. It was built on the chassis of the proven [[Panzer III]]. Initially intended as a mobile, armored light gun for infantry support, the StuG was continually modified and was widely employed as a tank destroyer.

When the [[Sturmgeschutz IV|Sturmgeschütz IV]] entered production in late 1943 and early 1944, the "III" was added to the name to separate it from the [[Panzer IV]]-based assault guns. All previous and following models were thereafter known as Sturmgeschütz III.

* [[Girls und Panzer]]

* "GuP website: Sturmgeschutz III Ausf. F":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_3go.html

title: jagdtiger
body:
[b]Jagdtiger[/b] ("Hunting Tiger") is the common name of a German heavy [[tank destroyer]] of [[World War II]]. The official German designation was [b]Panzerjäger Tiger Ausf. B[/b] as it was based on a lengthened [[Tiger II]] chassis. The 71-tonne Jagdtiger was the heaviest armored fighting vehicle used operationally during [[World War II]] and is the heaviest armored vehicle of any type to achieve series production. The vehicle carried a 128 mm PaK 44 L/55 main gun, capable of out-ranging and defeating any fielded Allied [[tank]].

However, the tank suffered from a similar overweight issue with its base model, which is further exacerbated by the front-heavy centre of gravity. Resulted in a frequent brakedowns that added further strains on stuggling German logistics. The vehicle's increased weight also cause it to be even more underpowered and slower than the base model.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

* "GuP website: Jagdpanzer VI 'Jagdtiger'":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_bla_jt_s10.html

title: jagdpanther
body:
The Jagdpanther ("hunting panther") was a [[tank destroyer]] built by [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] during [[World War II]] based on the chassis of the [[Panther (tank)|]] (Panther). The Jagdpanther combined the very powerful 8.8 cm PaK 43 cannon of the [[Tiger II]] and the characteristically excellent armor and suspension of the Panther chassis.

title: xaihi_(arknights)
body:
A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Few people could immediately identify Xaihi's origins upon their first meeting with her. But the girl's occasional display of "Lateran vibes" would quickly reveal her affiliation with the Cabal of Tranquility.

Xaihi possesses a vast and seemingly trivial knowledge of many fields, especially those pertaining to information technology. During talks, she tends to jump from one strange topic to the next—a habit that one must get used to if they wish to converse with her. Xaihi herself, however, is utterly unaware of these issues.
[/quote]

title: jagmo
body:
JAGMO (Japan Game Music Orchestra) is Japan's first professional orchestra dedicated to video game music. Founded in 2014 by Tadakaz Mishiya, with game designer Masanobu Endo and composer Yuzo Koshiro serving as honorary chairmen, the orchestra is the successor to the Japan BGM Philharmonic Orchestra.

title: sugar_cube
body:
A small cube of sugar, used to sweeten coffee or other hot beverages.

h4.See also

* [[granulated sugar]]
* [[sugar bowl]]
* [[sugar tongs]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: chocolate_marquise
body:
A rich [[chocolate]] [[dessert]] made with dark chocolate, [[butter]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]], cocoa powder, [[egg|eggs]] and cream.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: sugar_bowl
body: A small lidded [[bowl]] used for holding [[granulated sugar]] or [[sugar cube]]s. It is usually included as part of a [[tea set]]. If the sugar bowl has a matching [[spoon]], there may be a notch in the lid for the spoon to stick out of while the lid is closed.

title: eggnog
body:
A dairy beverage made of [[milk]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and beaten [[egg]]s. Alcohol such as brandy, rum or bourbon might be added, and is garnished with cinnamon or nutmeg. Popular around [[Christmas]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: sukiyaki
body:
A type of [[nabe]] dish, cooked over a direct fire at the table in a nabe hot pot.

Sukiyaki contains thinly-sliced [[beef]], green vegetables, [[mushroom]]s, [[tofu]], [[spring onion]], and (often) [[noodles]], in a [[soy sauce]], [[granulated sugar]], mirin, and [[sake]] cooking broth. It is usually served with raw [[egg]] for dipping.

Also known as [i]gyuunabe[/i] (beef nabe).

h4. See also

* [[Nabe]]
* [[Oden]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukiyaki 
* "Pixpedia article (eng)":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Sukiyaki
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: coffee
body:
A hot [[drink]] that is made by filtering hot water through ground [[coffee beans]], popular for its aroma and concentrated dose of caffeine. Use this tag when coffee itself (ordinarily a black or dark brown liquid) is visible in an image.

It is normally served in a porcelain [[coffee mug]], but it can be taken on the go in a stainless steel mug, styrofoam cup, or in a paper [[disposable coffee cup]]. For the traditional porcelain or ceramic "coffee cups" that aren't mug-shaped, see [[teacup]].

As coffee can be quite bitter, it is often served accompanied by [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[milk]] or [[cream]]. It is usually consumed while hot, but it may be served over ice.

title: yukiya_ryuu
body:
Voice of [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] in [[Cookie (touhou)|Strawberry☆]] and a whole bunch of other voice dramas but none of them matter.

In 2022 she was arrested for doing a lot of drugs, frauding for 1.25 million yen, and stabbing her boyfriend. More info: https://archive.ph/2ir4T

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21118795

title: miramikaru_riran
body:
An original character for the [[Touhou]] voice drama あやつり異変 (Ayatsuri Ihen) that was made with Flipnote Gallery: World and popularized by [[manatsu_no_yo_no_inmu|Inmu]]/[[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]] fans. The author [[Riina (cookie)|]] was in elementary school when she drew it and has since distanced herself from it. Today, Riran and [[miramikaru miran|her sister]] are mostly associated with Cookie☆.

A youkai [[fox girl|kitsune]] with the ability to drive people mad. Some jokes about her animation include drawing her with a red [[rice bowl]] or a purple seat belt or rod. She has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]], [[red eyes]], [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and a [[single sidelock|sidelock]] on her left. She wears an [[open vest|open]] [[brown vest]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[brown skirt]], and a [[black necktie]]. Her signature spell card is called Dark Inferno. 

Riran was first criticized for being an OC in a Touhou voice drama, but people began to draw her more as time went on. This was compounded by the release of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]] which had both a [[Junko (touhou)|fox]] and a character that [[Clownpiece|drives people mad]]. Another coincidence was [[Senko_(sewayaki_kitsune_no_senko-san)|]] who happened to look similar. Since then, Riran has become the unofficial mascot of Cookie as an independent fandom outside of Touhou.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21049467

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: メッモー☆":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%A1%E3%83%83%E3%83%A2%E3%83%BC%E2%98%86
* "Nicopedia: Miramikaru Riran":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9F%E3%82%AB%E3%83%AB%E3%83%AA%E3%83%A9%E3%83%B3

title: geru_futota
body:
Voice of the [[Remilia Scarlet]] Cookie fundamentalist and Star Sapphire (as [[Shunga Youkyu]]) and Izayoi Sakuya (as [[Zwei (cookie)|]]) in [[Cookie (touhou)|Self-Contradiction☆]]. Her design was based on [[Hisaka (cookie)|]], but she wears a [[military uniform]] of a [[black hat]], [[black coat]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], [[black necktie]], [[black skirt]], and an [[armband]] with a [[broken heart print]]. Her name is a corruption of the German "Toter Geruch", meaning "smell of death". 

Known to have Dissociative Personality Disorder and deleting her twitter and disappearing after stating her was going to commit suicide, but came back eventually before disappearing completely in 2021. Seems to actually genuinely hate everything about Cookie, going on multi-paragraph rants against the community, the actors, the directors, the doxxers, and the fan artists on 5ch and Discord.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21105757
other_names: げるっふとーたぁ姉貴

title: yamin_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and Cirno in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Cirno has since been split off to become [[Cirno (cookie)]] and should be tagged separately. The only one of the original eight to also voice in later dramas, she avoided most of the controversy as she lived in a different part of Japan and sent her recordings over the internet. 

Although one of the main characters of the original voice drama, she later got grouped into the RIM family as the "child" character to [[Kanna (cookie)|]]'s "mother" attitude. Also seen with [[Manatsu no yo no inmu|Inmu]] characters far more than the rest of the cast. Sometimes drawn with a [[katana]] as a parody of Monster Hunter. A video of her in her room during a livestream tripping over a heater became memed.

Still active an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]] who collabs with Kanna. 

h4. Appearance

title: jigen_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Kasu☆]]. Identifiable by her [[long bangs]] [[hair over eyes|over her eyes]] and [[holding gun|holding a gun]], usually a [[revolver]]. The most popular character from Kasu☆, later getting bundled into the ALC faction of characters, although she still sometimes appears with [[Koga (cookie)|]] and [[833 (cookie)|]] from their voice drama. She has completely disappeared from the internet.

Unlike other Cookie characters, her online handle isn't actually Jigen, it is Teresa. However, her frame of her with her hair over her eyes and her generally calm voice and demeanor in the voice drama led to people calling her Jigen after [[Jigen Daisuke]]. The gunslinger persona followed. She was paired with [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] as a variant of the "badass and naive" trope.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21075434

title: akira_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Yagokoro Eirin]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆]] and [[Kazami Yuuka]] in Kuso☆☆☆. More famous as Yuuka with [[messy hair]], [[large breasts]], no ascot, and [[sanpaku]]. An active voice actress and cosplayer, she maintains unusually good relations with the Cookie community and like dirty jokes. 

Because [[Macota (cookie)|]]'s Yuuka spoke fast to earn the nickname Fast Talking Oba-san, Akira's speed was even faster to earn her the nickname Super Fast Talking Oba-san. Her lines about Valentine's day is a popular copypasta. 
[code]あらアリスじゃないあなたもお買い物をしにこの店を訪れたの？この店で材料を買って、誰かに美味しいお菓子を作って贈ろうということねちなみにバレンタインデーとはかつての古代ローマの祭りを異教を認めないキリスト教圏内でも続けるためにヴァレンティヌスという架空の聖人を作り上げこれを悼むための日としたのが始まりと言われており今では恋人たちの日として世界各地で親しまれている。皆様はバレンタインデーを毎日いかがお過ごしですか

Oh my, if it isn't Alice. Did you come here to do shopping too? You wanted some ingredients so that you could make some sweets as a present for someone, right? Incidentally, Valentine of Valentine's Day was a fictional saint created so that those within the Christian circle who refused Paganism could continue the festivals of ancient Rome. It used to be a day of lament for Saint Valentine, but now it is more familiar known around the world as a day for lovers. Has everyone been spending their Valentine's Day well this year?[/code]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21073120
* !asset #21073121

title: nyon_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Nazrin]] and [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and artist in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]], almost exclusively appearing as Nazrin. Atouda let her play Nazrin since the original voice was unavailable and Nazrin was Nyon's favorite Touhou character. Briefly was a [[virtual youtuber]] named [[Suzukiri Iro]] before retiring after the Cookie fans' attention was too much. Her unique voice and cute appearance skyrocketed her popularity.

Since she was the main person [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] interacted with during her most popular scene, Nyon became famous by association and also created a staggering amount of memes.
* "Nai desu": "Don't have it". Nazrin's response to Alice asking for ingredients (eggs, [[flour (cookie)|]], and [[milk (cookie)|]]) for baking. By far her most popular line, endlessly remixed and parodied. 
* "I also like Nazrin, Kogasa, and Nue. I like them all.": Her most famous line from a post-voice drama interview. She stressed the Nu in Nue, which became parodied as a very weird way of saying it. 
* NYN Bee and NYN Egg: In a [[bee costume]] and an [[egg costume]]. MAD material that became "canon" after the original artist of Nyon drew them. 
* [[Fake Nyon (cookie)|]]: An impersonator that achieved a decent level of fame. 
* Egg: To match Flour and Milk (and [[Butter (cookie)|]]). A taller, white skinned version of her drawn by her second artist. Sometimes treated as a separate character.
* "Atamawaruwaru": "Are you retarded?" A MAD material of her dancing set to the Honobono Shrine remix of Dichromatic Lotus Butterfly that went extremely viral
* "Anone, anone, [[crossbone_gundam|Crossbone]] will never be animated. I'd rather see [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|Hathaway's Flash]] animated than Crossbone.": Famous for both the first two words and the accurate prediction of Hathaway's Flash getting an adaptation in 2021 while Crossbone remains manga only.
* NYN Eevees: Drawing the [[eevee]]lutions as Nyons.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21074143
* !asset #22417574: Egg
* !asset #22417586: Rarely used, same artist as [[Akira (cookie)|]].

title: holding
body:
Someone is holding an object.

This tag should only be used for items you can pick up and carry with your hands. Don't use for holding body parts (like [[holding hands]], or [[breast hold|holding someone's breasts]]), or for holding clothing being worn (like a [[skirt hold]]), or for holding things with something other than the hands (like a [[mouth hold]], [[holding with feet]], or [[holding with tail]]).

To search for something specific being held, just use two tags together, like this: {{holding popsicle}}. Note that these searches don't always work well. Many posts of a search like {{holding hat}} are people [i]wearing hats[/i] while [i]holding other things[/i], so it would be ineffective to see people [i]holding hats[/i]. Hence the existence of specialized tags.

h4. List of holding tags

h6. Items

* [[Holding book]]
* [[Holding bowl]]
* [[Holding card]]

body:

Not to be confused with [[sandals]], which leave the toes uncovered by default. Sandals leave most of the foot uncovered, aside from the straps holding them onto the foot, while open-toe shoes cover the top or sides of the foot, leaving only the toes uncovered.

body:

She wears a [[black leotard]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[black thighhighs]].

Her default costume consists of a [[black sweater]] with a [[race bib]] (often with a [[lanyard]] on), [[purple pants|purple]] [[sweatpants]], and [[untied shoelaces|untied]] [[black footwear|black]] [[multicolored footwear|and]] [[purple footwear|purple]] [[sneakers]]. She also wears a [[black nails|black]] [[nail polish]] and a [[white shirt]] underneath her sweater. Due to her instability when transforming into a human form, she has [[asymmetrical arms]], with her left arm retaining its dragon form (with a [[wristband]] and [[bandaged arm|wrapped]] by [[bandages]]) and she has a large [[dragon tail]].

title: shoes
body:
A covering for the foot, typically with a sturdy sole and a soft upper half, with the cuff not reaching above the ankle.

This tag generally includes any type of closed shoe less than ankle-height, including [[sneakers]], [[loafers]], [[Mary Janes]], [[high heels]], etc. It does not include other types of shoes, such as [[boots]], [[sandals]], [[slippers]], etc, that either go past the ankle, don't cover the whole foot, or aren't made of sturdy material.

title: kain_r_heinlein
body:
The main villain of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. 

Following a poor upbringing alongside his brother [[Grant (SNK)|Abel, a.k.a. Grant]], and sister Marie, Kain swore to gain power at all costs. After the death of South Town's infamous crime lord [[Geese Howard]], Kain would ultimately gain power and take his place as the ruler of South Town's underworld. To prove his might, he hosted the latest edition of South Town's legendary King of Fighters martial arts tournament - The King of Fighters: Maximum Mayhem. He claims to be the uncle of [[Rock Howard]], as his sister Marie was a lover of Geese's. Though Rock long believed his mother Marie was dead, Kain claims she is indeed alive, convincing Rock to work with him for a time.

Kain returns in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], with [[Vox Reaper]] taking Grant's place as his new enforcer.
other_names: カイン・R・ハインライン

title: akatsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akatsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] that can be fairly [[messy_hair|messy]], and usually has a tuft of [[hair_between_eyes|hair between her eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]), but with [[black pantyhose]], a [[flat cap]], and the "III" badge on the left side of her collar.

She does her best to act like a true lady and thus doesn't like to be [[age_conscious|treated as a child]], especially in regards to [[headpat]]ting. Her protests that she is a "full-fledged lady" or "first-class lady" have become something of a catchphrase: [[ichininmae no lady]]. This has the side effect of making her look even more childish. Many characters enjoy teasing her by doing things that play upon her being childish, such as giving her [[okosama_lunch|children's meals]].

title: atlanta_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of USS [i]Atlanta[/i] (CL-51) of the United States Navy. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]].

She is tall with [[large breasts]], and has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle and [[grey eyes]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[garrison cap]] with the number 51 written on it, silver [[star earrings]], an [[anchor hair ornament]], a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] that reaches her thighs, a [[high-waist_skirt|high-waisted]] [[black skirt|black]] [[suspender skirt]] over it that also reaches her upper thighs. [[Garter straps]] are visible below her skirt, attached to two [[thigh strap]]s. She also wears [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder_footwear|rudder]] [[boots]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] which expose only her thumb and index finger and cover the other fingers in a mitten-style. Her [[machinery]] includes four [[ship turret|turret]]s and a [[crane_(machine)|]].

She is cool, laid back, and even somewhat aloof and/or easily irritated, in contrast to many of the American shipgirls who came before her. She has a particular aversion to night battles and Japanese destroyers, [[Akatsuki (kancolle)|]] and [[Yuudachi (kancolle)|]] in particular, in reference to her historical fate. She is often compared to [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]], who also has brown hair and a similar haircut but a flat chest.

The historical [i]Atlanta[/i] was heavily damaged after sinking Japanese destroyer [[akatsuki (kancolle)|Akatsuki]] during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal. She was sunk on her captain's orders later on the same day.

title: roma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and [[brown eyes]] with [[pince-nez]] [[glasses]]. 

Her default outfit is similar to her sister [[Littorio (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with additional [[detached sleeves]] and a [[white capelet]], [[grey corset]], [[red skirt]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red horizontal stripes, [[white hat|white]] [[headdress]], and grey-green [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is a split hull with the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow stripes, her three 381 mm triple gun mounts, and additional [[anti-aircraft gun]]s at kai form.

Historically, [i]Roma[/i] was sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] as she, her sister-ships and other units in the Italian fleet attempted to sail to Malta to surrender to the British. Because of her real-life counterpart's fate, she is often portrayed as having a grudge toward German ship girls.

title: maestrale_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[tan]] skin with visible [[tanlines]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, [[striped panties]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and propellers to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. Her kai form includes a third 120 mm single gun mount on the funnel.

title: grecale_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Grecale[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[tan|uniformly tanned skin]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. As she was the only one of the class that survived to the Armistice (and the war), she also has additional 20 and 37 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her funnel rig at kai form. 

Her personality is one of a [[mesugaki]]-type: flirty and teasing. She is the only one of her class who survived the war, reflecting in her high luck and evasion stats.

title: comandante_cappellini_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian submarine [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and with an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. 

Her default outfit (representing her Italian service) consists of a [[black vest]], [[black shorts]] underneath a [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]]. As [[UIT-24 (kancolle)|]] she wears a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], and as [[I-503 (Kancolle)|]] she wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]].

The historical [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i] was seized by the Japanese after the Italian surrender in 1943 and handed over to Germany as [i]UIT-24[/i]. She was seized back by the Japanese after the German surrender in 1945 and commissioned as [i]I-503[/i].
